body without wemme common birth also medled wich seruice venus neither resolued lecherie neither brused sorrowe birth child yet bring forth swarmes young fowles bring foorth vnneth one birth yeare euery one bée bringeth foorth two passeth double plenteousnes increase bées make among king ordayne among common people though put set vnder king yet frée loue king make kinde loue defend full great defence holde honour worship perish spilt king king great worship none dare goe theyr house get meate except king passe take principalytie flight bées choose king worthy noble hightnesse fairnesse cléere mildnesse chiefe vertue king though theyr king haue sting yet vseth wreake kindly huge bées lighter greater bées lyghter lesse bées also bee vnobedient king déeme themselues theyr owne dome dye wound theyr owne sting swarme bee none idle fight battayle field bées busie meate watch comming shower behold concourse méeting deawes make wexe flower make cels round square wonderfull binding ioyning euennesse yet neuerthelesse among diuers workes none doeth aspye wayte take others trauayle neither taketh wrongfullye neither stealeth meate séeketh gathereth owne flight trauayle among hearbes flower good couenable bées haue sting shedde venyme among honny anye thing ouersetteth put lyues kinde reuenge defence theyr house also though feeble strength body yet full strong might vertue cunning theyr fruite softe swéete thing swéetnes maketh iawes swéet healeth woundes giueth medicine inward botch huc v que ambrosius property aristotle toucheth libro decimo set also among thing saye working bées diuers bring hiue thing need araye hony sprayes flower trées hearbes namely thing deale gleymie glewie bameth therewith hiue noyful beast entering hiue bee large make narrow straight gather honny first begin make house king shall dwell make house bées kéepe hiue take waxe floures gather forséete gather middle féete ouer ioynts hinder féete flye therewith heauinesse bee knowen bee flyeth taketh heede diuersitie flower leaueth one flower another findeth therein needfull turneth againe hir owne place charged gather honny matter honny maye lyghtly distinguish feelyng haunt much gladly leaues flower olyue abide therevpon long time thicknesse leaues king may flye company bee beare rector liue male one partie female another partie dead male female one house rectours female much female ye bées hath stōrg sting ye male many male wtout sting flye though would sting sting yet may rector two manner one blacke red better good little bee round thicke selfe small middle though girded meanly rough bee diuers feeding fedde flower garden manner bee fedde flower mountaines fedde tree mountaines lesse stronger may better away trauayle also bee sit vpon hiues sucke superfluitie honie combes said thereof spider gendred superfluitie bee dye little honnie house forsake come house fight take away honnie therefore seene ofte sitting hole readie arayed withstand defend shorter bee fight longer strong sight eate much hony busie themselues driue hiues make honie labour also king séene without hiues alone haue great company bées king middle passeth three dayes passing ye young bées bées come flye hiues departe themselues company euery king goeth one companie happeneth one part bées set bées remaine goe another king forsake theyr first king goe king hath number king whome forsake doeth followe kill also bee sting dye right soone sting sting drawe place stung ye sting may come except gutte come therewith rectours bées sting seldome bee dye hiue bées drawe beast cleanly beastes therefore cleanse flieng hiue stinking sauour grieueth full sore likwise doeth winde also therefore great winde wardene bées shall couer mouth hiue winde come bee hiues stinke wise forsake hiues hap bées abide therein shall take sicknesse stench rest much sick throw put idle bées company hot place according thē winter time colde summer time man leueth much hony worke much thereafter leaueth little wexe slow worke hony therefore warden shall leaue hony multitude thē lesse lacke honny ease warden shall féede figges swéete meates least shoulde dye gather together striue within hiue token depart thence forsake hiue therefore warden must powre swéete wine hiue abide still huc vsque aristoteles liber 8 si • e 9 also liber 4 sayth bées make noyse styeng spreading drawing wing •• e falleth betwéene wing bodyes also hinder féete bée longer theyr fore féet going may soone arise earth whē flye saith lib 14 also sometimes bées haue sicknesse aristotle calleth ka • roys l 8 euill commeth little wormes gendered hiue commeth corrupt hunnie combes worm waxen make web like web spider hath mastry ouer hiue therefore hunny waxeth corrupt bee waxe sicke die also li 16 hée sayth bées gendered seruice venus yéeres dropping many bee bread gendered moysture superfluity multiplyed body temperate yéeres bée fewe bird bées saith item dietis particularibus sayde bées eat flowres almond trées make temporale hunnye sauoury lesse sharpe hunny cleanseth spirituall member bées eat wormwood bitter hearbes make hunnie lesse swéet yet hunnie cleanseth stopping splene openeth liuer helpeth haue dropsie helpeth biting madde dogge look hunny tracttau de liquoribus propertyes bées shall ye finde littera tractatu de animalibus secundum pth et auicennam owle chap 5 owle called bubo hath name sound voice isidore sayth wilde birde charged feather alwaye holde slouth féeble flye dwelleth graues daye night chinnes diuinours tell betoken euill owle séene citie signifieth destruction wast isidore saith aristotle saith li 8 chough fighteth owle féeble sight midday séeth clearely night daye ye cause chough taketh owles egges eateth daye owle eateth choughes egges night owle stronger night day chough stronger day night fowles flye owle day pul therfore owle fowlars take bird fowles fighting bird fighting beast meat dwelling place crieng owle night betokeneth death diuinors coniecture déeme owle fed dirt vncleane thing hated bird haunteth temple night haue hir fill oyle lampes namely fethers beake séemeth lyke fowles pray vnlike boldnesse vertue bird fowles assayle owle lyeth vpright defendeth hir selfe hir beake hir feete hunt ate mouse reremice flye night hide thins wall daye additiō kinde owles bée many gesner tearmeth solitarie one called tachmas gréedines night rauener foure kind cō mon first reddish browne full fethers greatest called asse owle fethers sticke vp side head like horne seconde graye somewhat whitish breasted finely spotted hath shriking voyce third kinde lesser browne colour birder make stales take small bird fourth least bréedeth stonie rockes ash coloured read gesner ¶of culuer doue chap 6 culuers called columbe haue name colore ye neck necke feather sprong many diuers colour isid saith culuers milde bird meeke haunt loue company men haue conuersation multiplieng olde time men called venerias lecherous vse ofte neasts conceiue billing loue use much lecherie therefore culuer called columba colens lumbos tilling landes reynes isid sayth culuers lay time haue birdes dwelling hot meate ready haue better birdes haruest springing time summer plentie meate isid saith li 5 arist speaking kinde culuers saith culuer lecherous birde kisse bill treading old male may tread yet ceaseth bill often female leapeth vpon female male lacketh kissing billing cast semen manner treading sometime come egges egges come birdes winde egges birdes like culuers lay springing time twice thrice lay two egges lay third time second laieng corrupt destroyed also li 6 saith part culuers haue two birdes male female first bird male time one bird hatcht commeth shell one daye morrowe male sitteth brood day female night first egge filleth selfe sheddeth twentie day first culuer pearceth shell dealeth male female heateth bird one time female busie birdes male laieth egges ten time one yeare sometime xi time xii aegypt male treadeth female one yeare also lib 8 sayeth culuer hath birdes anone male ruleth birdes female tarie ouer long ere shée come byrdes sorenesse birth male smiteth beateth hir compelleth hir sit hir selfe vpon birdes birdes wex male goeth sucketh salte earth giueth putteth mouth birdes make haue talent meate male put bird neast treadeth also culuers haue propertie turtells haue areare lyfte vp head drinke ere haue dronke inough generally liue bréeds fiftéene yeares huc vsque arist property culuers vsuall notably knowen glose toucheth vppon sentence oculus tui columbarum cant 1 sayd culuer hath gall hurteth woundeth bill owne pere moreouer maketh neast dennes hole stone féedeth others bird draweth companye culuers wander straye abideth nigh riuers eateth best greynes hath groning stéede song flye flockes loue companye defende themselues wing bill eate carraines vncleane thing culuer feedeth two bird culuer sitting riuers séeth shadow goshawke comming seene séeth goshawke flyeth inner place hoale hideth selfe sayeth glose vpon foresayd sentence constantine sayth viatico bloud culuer medicinable sayd bloud drawen vnder right wing dropped hot swageth slaketh ach bleared eyen hath burning dirt throweth neast custometh teacheth hir birdes likewise cast aristotle saiththe propertie doues culuer messenger peace ensample simplenes cleane kinde plenteous young follower méeknesse friend companye forgetter wrong feathered plentuous kinde founde therefore rough sooted doues bréede well nigh euerye month culuer kindly fearfull seldome safetie shée hole stone resteth time culuer forgetfull therefore birdes borne awaye forgetteth hir harme damage leaueth therefore build bréede place ierome sayth also nicely curious sitting trée beholdeth looketh toward part fly bendeth hir necke taking aduisement oft taketh aduisement flight ere taketh hir flight arrowe flyeth thorough hir body therefore fayleth hir purpose long doe performed due time gregory sayth also sayd dietis perticularibus culuer flesh hard digest gleymie therefore giueth great nourishing thicke namely flesh young culuers begin flye mouing trauayle looseth much heauinesse flesh made light able digest elder ye harder worse digest worse nourishing giueth body also sometime culuour found faught beguile despise wilde culuours leadeth net deceiue stilye goeth fowler net suffreth selfe caught wrapped therein draweth toward meate wer liknes friendship féeding draweth grin destruction also ambrose sayth aegypt syria culuer taught beare letter messenger one prouince another loueth kindly place dwelling wher first fed nourished neuer farre borne farre country alway returne home againe restored fréedome oft culuer letter craftely bound vnder one wing let go flieth vp aire ceaseth neuer till come ye first place bred sometime way enemy know thereof letteth arrowe letter beareth wounded slaine beareth letter without perill ofte letter borne cause occasion death additiō doues likewise diuers sortes stockdoue woodcoyst house doue turtle doue common flesh doues contrarye body grieued goute cause ache bone heate bloud ripen postumate humoures flesh splitted hot layd anye part bodye draweth humour phisition ¶of curlewe chap 7 curlewes called cotumices haue name sownd voyce certaine birdes gréekes call ortigias wer first séene lande called ortigia isidore saith birdes haue certaine time comming make lead flockes dread gossehawke sée goshauk arise earth therefore called ortigometra also bird haue guide leader crane haue dread goshauke busie comforte leader leader ware warned perill harme taken gossehawkethe curlevv hath ye falling euill onely birdes haue ye falling euill man hath sparowes also passe sea wearie fall downe vpon water rest vppon one wing maketh sayle wing best meate venemous seede graines cause olde time men forbad eating hearbe called eleborus curlewes meate another beast eateth great quantitie perillous poyson beast haue broad wide veynes ye smoke passeth strength hearbe heart sodainly cooled dead curlewes haue straight veynes heart therfore venemous smoke hath passage bideth stomacke defied made subtill grieueth call common speach coturnices crebros veloci cursu swifte running runneth vpon earth swiftly birdes loue birdes owne kinde therefore euerie cry come together ambrose saith additiō coturnix thought féede venemous séedes therefore wholsome ¶of storke chap 8 storke water fowle purgeth hir selfe owne bill séeleth hir selfe griened much meate taketh sea water hir bill putteth hir harder hole hir guttes water suitneth hardnesse ye meat biting gut causeth put superfluity also bird easeth egs adder serpentes beareth best meate hir birdes isidore saith bird called siconia sicannia smiteth flappeth bill maketh noyse cane great réeds saith also messenger springing time hir comming betokeneth noueltie time enemie adder serpent beateth slayeth hir bill sometime swalloweth deuoureth haunteth loueth company men therefore make theyr neasts house men dwell leane lightly first neaste except compelled ere go country winter fill neasts earth draw twigges thornes neasts fenne tempest winde breake throw downe winter hir comming againe springing time occupieth place defendeth neast would occupy female liueth male accompanieth 〈1 page duplicate〉 another seruice venus kéepeth truely hir neast office generation male espieth wise yt female hath broke spousehood shall dwell beateth striketh hir bill slaieth hir may aristo saith male treadeth female neast sitting brood male female chaunge time loue bird kéepe right great affection busie sitting vppon fethers fall male trauayleth meate female sitteth neast againward male commeth home female flyeth meate male sitteth neast ambrose saieth storkes flye ouer sea flockes flye together hot country passing crowes flye passe wer leading storkes withstand might fowles yt hate storkes sayd exameron though storkes eate venemous beast frog adder serpent yet neuerthelesse venime ouercommeth neither chaungeth kinde féeding nourishing venimous men beast vertue heate hath mastrie within mallice venime quenched also birdes haught haue féete legges bill full blacke swan haue ye blacknesse passeth away lyttle lyttle olde redde haue leg féete bill additiōa storke shape like vnto heron biggeriall white sauing top wing bill leg red naturally enimie ye latines name gréeke diuinoures tell taketh héede spiengs awaitings teacheth showeth wayes warneth shall fall full vnlawfull beléeue god sheweth priuie counsaile crowes isidore saith among manye vnmilde grieuous men dwell sayth eateth vncleane meates venomous lyueth right long age fethers wexe white flesh within longer liue blacke hateth fore ouer beast fighteth sparhawke gossehawke isidore therof time ye storkes passe ye country crowes séene place thers wont also come againe • e wound voice blood wel knowen signes tokēs shew yt haue ben strōg fighting also said yt mildnes bird diseased state againe rauen chap 10 rauen called coruus corax also hath name sowne throte isido sayth rauen beholdeth mouth hir bird yane giueth meate ere know sée likenesse hir owne blacknesse hir owne colour fethers begin wexe blacke afterward feedeth wt hir might strength isidore saith sayd rauens birdes fed deaw heauen time haue blacke feather benefite age ye time fed vsuall meate carren guilefull bird taketh away thing thee •• shly layeth hydeth priuie place also vncleane bird sitteth vpon carrens asketh taketh meate venemous vncleane thing diuinours meane rauen hath manner vertue meaning betokening diuination therefore among nation rauen among foules hallowed appollo marcius saith aristotle li 6 speaking rauen saith onely female sitteth broode twentye dayes egges male bringeth hir meate haue manie byrdes sitteth broode twentye dayes many throw away bird fowles haue many bird throwe awaye also li 8 sayth blacke rauen fighteth asse bul flieth vpon grieueth smiteth bill swanne chap 11 swan called cignus latin olor gréeke white feather man findeth black swan olor gréeke vnderstand white isid saith swan called cignus hath name canendo singing faineth swéetnes swéet song accord voice singeth swéetly hath long neck diuersly bent make diuers note sayd country called hiperbores harper harping swan birdes flye neasts sing full merely isidore saith marcius ambrose say shipmen trowe betokeneth good méete swan perill shipwracke alway swan meriest bird diuinations shipmen desire bird doppeth downe waues therefore hallowed apollo marcius sayth strength wing swan louea fond fayning svvanne singeth vvho hath naturall voice birdes haue hée seeketh female pleaseth hir beclipping necke draweth hir ward ioyneth neck female necke binding neckes together treading female smileth male flieth male batheth ofte treding doth female also ere take meate shall dye feather pight brayne singeth vsage beast stéede groning swan singeth ambrose saith swan hath white fethers without mingling blacknesse colour hath blacke flesh hard digested hath bill manner bounching distinguisheth sight smell tast bill full blacke within inwarde full thicke swan putteth downe head water séeketh meate cutteth though nourished among fish yet eateth also bread meate throwen withdraweth giueth place fish followeth séeketh gathereth meale hearbes grasse rootes hath blacke feete close hole broad full able swim swimming vseth one foote stéede oare foote steede stirrer ruleth himselfe therewith dwelleth lake pondes maketh neast nigh water vpon fewe stickes throwen togethers swan sitteth broode bringeth forth birdes féedeth busily bringeth vp couereth defendeth winges bill hissing man come toward signet swan putteth hir selfe among birdes prepareth make resistaunce ceaseth defend hir birdes birde great wayght heauinesse much flesh bodie therefore shée loueth rest flyeth seldome wilde swan flye strong flight neckes strayght forwarde féete straight backwarde great bodye fat tame swan nourished fed nigh place thereas men inhabite marcius saith ¶of gnat chap 12 gnat little flie called culex hath name aculeo sting sucketh bloud hath mouth pipe like prick therewith pearceth flesh suck bloud accounted among volatile bee though haue body worme many feete hee hath wing flyeth therewith gendred rotted corrupt vapour carrens corrupt place marreyes continual flapping wing maketh noyse aire though hurred sitteth gladly vpon carraines botch scabbes sore full noyfull scabbed horse sore backed grieueth sléeping men noyse biting waketh rest flyeth night pearceth bileth member vpon sitteth draweth toward lyght gladly seeth lyght vnwarely falleth candle fire coueting sée lyght burneth himselfe ofte best féeding swallowes gnat taken best beloued meate swalowes flye aire hunt fly called sciniphes vnderstand small fly noyfull sting scines gréeke musca latine flye english therof commeth scinomia houndes flye fly land aegypt smitten isidore sayth scinomia worst kinde flyes greater bodye broader wombes flyes lesse flight full tender cleaue fast member beast smite wooll haire bristle beast namely hound flye hideth hir selfe sucketh drinketh bloud insomuch gnaweth flesh maketh swell botch pimple fareth eares old hound eares flyes gnawe make swell full sore wonder though flyes stinke right foule fedde corrupt meates humour ¶of cicada chap 13 manner grassehopper called long thighes scale side like edge knife glasse drawen fro maketh noise setteth teeth edge haue diligently tried bartholome heerin deceiued want experience cicada middle heate midday trées breake heate arabian bird phenix bred called singularis alone isid saith philosopher speketh bird saith phenix bird without make liueth iii hundred v hundred yeares ye yeares passed féeleth hir owne default féeblenesse maketh nest right swéete smelling stickes full daye summer ye westerne winde bloweth stickes neast set fire burning heate sun burneth strongly bird phenix commeth wilfully burning neast burnt ash among burning stickes within three day litle worme gendered ash waxeth little litle taketh feather shapen turned bird ambrose saith exameron humor ash phoenix ariseth new bird waxeth space grea • iuyce shall sure panther lyon bone cock hen medled gold molte destroy wast golde henne boanes venemous golde wonder also cocke hot drye complection therefore full bolde hardie fighteth boldly hen aduersaries assayleth reeseth teareth woundeth bill spore hath mastry croweth presently ere croweth beateth himselfe wing make able sing vseth late night crowe cléerely strongly morrow tide shapeth tight voice song ambrose saith cocke beareth redde combe head steede crowne béeing left looseth hardinesse slowe cowardlye assayle aduersary loueth ieolouslye hennes findeth meate calleth hennes together certaine voyce spareth owne meate féede therewith setteth next rooste hen fat tender leueth hir best desireth haue hir presence morrow tide flyeth get meate first layeth side hir side certayne token beckes long • ache wooeth prayeth hir treading fighteth hir speciallye though iealous bill spore chaseth driueth away cockes come nigh hennes fighting smiteth ground bill reareth vp feather necke make bold hardy mooueth feather tayle vpwarde downward maye ably come battaile breedeth precious stone called aflect • e • •• like stone named calceduneus manye haue written heart say bu • fer • e capr •• ence cock beareth stone stone men trow lion dreadeth abhorreth specially cocke white lyon dreadeth white cocke plinius sayth cocke hée searcheth meate bill feete setayeth ouertourneth strawe duste hée findeth grayne hée calleth cackeleth hen also cocke dreadeth eagle gossehawke take theyr pray ground sowles pray spye wayte bird goe grounde cocke right sharpe sight therefore looketh downwarde one eye search meate vpwarde ayre eye might beware comming eagle goshauke set one come farre anon crieth hen flieth away hideth himselfe house among stone hedge saith also right aged cocke laieth egges last ende egges small full round wanne yeolow venimous worme sitteth brood canicular day bée bred growe cockatrice beda sayth constantine speaketh cock saith young cockes difference betwéene houres night beateth himselfe wing araieth himselfe fighting sitteth broode vppon egges owne henne taketh vppon office female feedeth chickins bée owne leadeth clocketh hen calleth accounted among volatile deutronomi 14 glose sayth gripe foure footed lyke eagle head wing like lion part body dwelleth hilles called hiperborei bée enimies horse men gréeueth layeth neast stone called smaragdus venimous beast mountaine additiōof kind straeing beast many bée doubt whether bee worlde notwithstanding séemeth credible writer ther diuerse especially among hiperborie people beast fawlcon chap 20 faulcon called herodius royall fowle desireth praye vseth sit hand beareth bolde birde hardye gosehauke hath little flesh comparison bodye hath many feather therefore lyght flye little thing beareth downewarde much beareth vpward gregory sayth therefore right lyke estridge boldnesse strength also much like thereto diuers feather coulours faulcon full bolde hardy sharpest breast strong clawes hurteth pray rising theron breast bill clawes greate hearted fayle pray first flyght réefe second taketh wreake himselfe wilde vnneth day seeketh praye hee tame shame flyeth aboute ayre vnneth commeth lordes handes holdeth himselfe ouercome put kind taketh foule flyeth gregorie saith foule bird commonly called falco fulica also glose sayth super spalmum among birdes fowles fowles haue little affection take little héede birdes said exameron office businesse feedeth owne bird seruice taketh féedeth bird eagle throweth neast vnknowne flyeth voideth carrion toucheth stinking flesh strong hunger may well awaye trauaile absteineth abideth till maye finde couenable praye séeketh gregorye saith additiō hawkes pray onely pastime prince next idle person set inch pleasure thē ell thrift bestow hauks hound would suffice twice many poore men sometime taking one pray vi ye charge much wonne stand twentie markes according olde prouerbe gentleman pleasure gentle fauoureth poore profit common wealth lasciuiously spendeth one yéere parent got 20 referre prudent swallow chap 21 swallow called hirundo arundo ab aere hath name ayre hée taketh meate sitting flyeng ayre isidore saith crieng fowle flyeth euen hether thether sometime busie making neastes feeding bird saith also making neasts swallow cunning vnneth man wit sufficient make matter worke swallow maketh shapeth claye onely bill moreouer swallowe full feather lyghtest swiftest flight foules therefore fowles réeseth distroubleth swallow neither swallow pray birdes flieth ouer sea hot countryes countryes abideth winter men suppose also kéepe certain time comming going againe comming token springing time witnesse faire summer resplendishing weather ambrose saith libro sexto aristotle sayth speaking swallowe li 6 wilde fowle treadeth laieth egges yeare except swallowe layeth egges twice yere somtime first egges broke coldnesse winter latter egges complete bring forth bird also sayd birdes eate flesh lay egges twice yeere except swallowe hath sometime birdes twice yeare also sayd yt man put young swallowes eien yet eien come agayne shee fetcheth hearbe called celidonia baumeth eien bird iuyce thereof eien restored againe macro saith proued addition toke effect yet founde stone straunge coulours also swallow wombe two stone sound one whitish called female red called male hée vertuous white stone bée called celidonij bée precious stone namelye taken bird ere touch ground sayde lapida • e vertues described constanine saith bloud drawen vnder right wing medicinable eyen bloud doue durt full hot full gnawing therefore gréeueth eien swallowe techeth bird throw durt ye neast two manner swallowes great body haue blacke ridge red breast white wombes loue men companye make neasts men house bée lesse bodye haue blacke breast make neasts hole chin roches rockes fast water kindes make neasts earth clay theyr tayles bée forked payre shéeres called martines addition good eate also saide among swallowes one manner kinde fowles dread kinde yea ye eagle goshauke dread flie ye swallow enimie dare fall pray sée ye swallow dreade biting peraduenture venimous plinius sayth swallowes fight agaynst sparrowes come neasts driue biting scratching additiō called sea swallowe big bodied thrush short legged meruailous swiftnesse blacke sauing th •• toward legges gray kaladrius chap 22 philosopher saith birde called kaladrius white coulour hath parte blacknesse neather part leg cleanseth purgeth dimnesse eyen kinde man helde great sicknesse birde kaladrius turneth away face sick without doubt man shall die sicke man shal escape bird kaladrius setteth sight beholdeth fauning pleasing bird bird called calandra singeth thrustle glose saith deut 14 said calaudreon another calundre c additiō gesner sayth calandra small bird like larke supposed woode larke doctor turnar singing anye man féete lyeng sick made tame may héereafter better knowne larus cap 23 bird called larus inhabiteth somtime water somtime land therfore aurora written latus est fluminis habitator et incola terrae nunc natat vt pisces nunc volat inslar auis vnderstand larus dwelleth riuers lande swimmeth fishe also flyeth bird addition taken sea cobbe birdes kinde gesner locusta chap 24 locusta hath name hath long legges shaft speare therefore gréekes call hastagion isidore sayth wormes called locust haue king yet passe forth ordinatly companyes sayde prouerbiorum 30 eate eateth lesse bée séene summer hidde winter hinder leg longer fore leg glose sayth super 1 ioel first hée young hée athalabus afterwarde wing bée growen made locusta gréeueth youth athelabus age locusta hath square mouth sting stéede taile crooked solding legges eate burgenings trées hearbes gnawe gendered southerne winde excited flight die northerne wind leaping areare themselues rearing fall fatted flower almons also worme locusta part wombe therefore hath neuer meate inough hath one gut alwaye full filth vncleannesse alway hungred liueth findeth anye thing gréene gnaweth cesaeth little colde falleth dead quickeneth againe heate ye sun dirt wormes gendered additiō straunge kinde flie hath long hinder legges grashopper burneth corne touching deuoureth residue india thrée foote length people country doe eate cooper coote chap 25 coote called mergulus hath name oft dopping plunging oft putting downe head water dopping vnder hee sheweth signes token weather comming tempest sea flyeth crieng shoare betokeneth certeinly full strong tempest sea cootes flie crieng shore isidore sayth coot maketh flight strēgth therefore called miluus quasi molliter volans wer weakly flieng borne vp aboue aire light feather hooueth vnmouable flieng séemeth vnneth moueth aire softe touching bird may well away trauaile therefore taketh cuckoes vpon shoulder beareth least faile space long wayes bringeth ye country spaine many secret nature •• knowen yet •• doubtful isid saith rauishing foule hardy among small bird coward fearefull among great birdes dreadeth lie waite take wilde birdes dreadeth lye waite take tame birdes lyeth oft waite take chickins findeth vnware saieth eateth carrion vncleane thing little meate fill tho womb fleeth ayre taken sparhauke faintnesse towardnesse hée ouercome birde lesse youth seemeth difference betwéene kite birdes praye longer hée liueth sheweth kinde vnkinde 28 miredromble called onacrocalus bird maketh noyse winter hath small chin iawes hée taketh first meate sendeth second wombe hath two wombes one onelye hée taketh meate onely séetheth defieth first hinderance author mallard ducke bitter wigen teale puffin barnacle bargander gulles twite wilde goose sheldrake many others pellican chap 29 pellican birde called porphitio leui 11 deut 14 birde aegypt dwelleth desart beside riuer nilus accounted among vncleane birdes lawe leuit two manner pellicans one dwelleth water eateth fish dwelleth land loueth wildernesse eateth venimous beast lisardes pellican eateth plungeth water foote hath plunged water puteth mouth soot hand pellican popiniay among foules vse foote stéed hand also pellican glose speaketh super psalmum plinius saith manner pellican loueth much child child bée haught begin waxe hoare smite father mother face wherfore mother smiteth againe slaieth thirde daye mother smiteth selfe side bloud runneth sheddeth hot bloud vppon body child vertue bloud birdes dead quicken againe glose vpon place psalmepsa 10 • 6 factus sum sicut pellicanus sayd pellican slayeth birdes bill maketh sorrowe thrée dayes sheddeth hot bloud vppon maketh aliue againe yt manner magister iacobus de vitriaco li de mirabilibua orientalium regionum telleth another cause death pellicanes birdes hée sayth aegypt bird yt called pellicanus birde greate wing leane swalloweth passeth forth anone behinde hée hath right slipper gut therefore hée maye holde meate till incorporate serpent hateth kindlye birde wherfore mother passeth neast get meate serpent climeth trée stingeth infecteth birdes commeth agayne shée maketh sorrowe thrée dayes birdes sayde sayth shée smiteth selfe breast bringeth bloud vppon reareth death lyfe greate bléeding mother waxeth féeble birdes bée compelled passe neast gette themselues meate kinde loue féede mother féeble vnkinde care mother mother taketh good héede thereto commeth strength nourisheth loueth birdes fedde néed putteth away birdes vnworthye vnkinde suffereth dwel liue partridge chap 30 partridge called perdix hath name owne voice isidore saith vncleane bird male lepeth vp treadeth male strong liking lechery forgetteth sexe distinction male female isidore sayth guilefull one stealeth egges sitteth abrood fraude hath fruite birdes bée haught heare voice owne mother forsake brooded egges kept owne birdes tourne followe theyr owne mother naturall isidore sayth ambrose also partridge trauaileth layeng brooding lyke foules doe arist saith fowles sayth bréed gender lightly partridge ye mother partridge flieth hunter till birdes flowen bird flowen shée damme flyeth calleth birdes young partridge soone hatcht follows damme séeke meat partridge hath fethers much flesh therefore féeble flight flight riseth little ground falleth oft ground little also ye partridge dreadeth ye sparhauk flieth long hée séeth sparhauke aire riseth frō ye earth aire noise ringing little bell flyeth vppon ground falleth net grinne ere ware plinius lib 29 ca 6 saith partridge gull euen weight honnie cléereth much sight therefore shall bee kept siluer boxe theyr eyen hony sod brasen vessell pecocke called p •• e hath name sounde voice flesh harde vnneth rotteth full hard soothing isidore saith aristotle sayth pecocke liueth twentie yeare hath chicken end three yeeres wing bee couloured pehen sitteth abroode thirtye dayes little soone shelles cloue hath chicken yeare layeth twelue egges lesse pecocke leeseth fethers first tree leeseth leaues fethers grow first leaues begin grow tree aristotle saith pecock bird loueth young male searcheth female seeketh egges breake may occupy lecherie female dreadeth hideth busily egges least pecocke might soone find arist sayth pecocke hath vnstedfast euill shapen head head serpent crest hath simple pace small necke areared blew breast taile ful bewty distinguished high wonderful fairenesse hath foulest féet riueled wondereth fairenesse fethers areareth vp circle head looketh féet seeth foulenesse feete lyke wer ashamed letteth fethers fall sodeinlye taile downeward though tooke héed fairenesse fethers hath horrible voice one sayth hath voice féend head serpent pace théefe lib 29 cap 6 plinius sayth yt pecock hath enuie man profit swalloweth owne durt full medicinable sold found sparrowes cap 32 sparrowes bée small birdes bée called passerci patuitate littlenesse isid saith sparrowe vnstedfast bird voice iangling maketh theyr neasts nigh dwelling habitation men full hot bird lecherous flesh oft taken meat exciteth carnall lust constantine sayth sparrowes laye many egges full busie bring vp birdes feede maketh neast hay fethers kéepeth neast cleane without durt therefore shée throweth durt birdes neast compelleth birdes throwe durt neast féede birdes spider wormes flyes eate venimous seedes henbane without hurt haue sometime leper falling euill female liueth longer male male iealous wife fighteth oft aristotle saith sparrow dreadeth wéesell hateth crieth warneth ye wéesell commeth waiteth biteth billeth haue neasts swallowes loue owne kinde birdes sparrowes leaue hap gather feed nourish theyr owne happeneth one thē taken grinne manner wise crieth help multitude sparrowes gathered togethers deliuer taken spéede hast might additiō proueth heate sooner wasted inner vertue cause gout leprosie hastours death estridge cap 33 estridge called strucio hath name word gréeke isidore saith hath bodie beast fethers sense also hath two féete bill foule weight heauinesse body flieth foules aire laieth egges foules neglecteth brood egges egges raken grauel •• brought forth heat nourishing dust isid saith aristotle speaketh strucio saith strucio making like foule point like foure footed beast hée flieth vp aire wing couenable flight making therof thin making selfe deale shape bird hath many fethers neather part body hath two féete foule cloue footed foure footed beast cause thereof greatnesse body likned foure footed beast foule hot swalloweth defieth wasteth yron auicen saith kinde wise ware thing graunteth strucio propertie lay greatest egges hardest shell occupied generation heat may temperate heat vehement shoulde cause die sooner property estridge gre toucheth super lob 29 sayde fethers strucio like colour fethers ye gentle fawlcon vertue fethers haue likenesse lacketh swiftnesse flight spreadeth wing flie yet riseth vp frō earth clothed thinne fethers made heauy great body time come shall laye egges heaue vp eye behold star called virgilie pliades laye egges constellation ariseth séene ye month iune sée star theyd digge grauell laye egges couer hide sande haue lefte forget anone layed come neuer againe thereto grauel chased heat sunne heateth egges hidde bréedeth bird therein bringeth foorth shell broke birdes come first mother gathereth nourisheth birde shée despised egge shée knoweth come egge therefore sayd iob hée made harde owne child though owne ¶also estridge hateth furniture turtle chap 34 turtle hath name voice simple birde culuour chast farre vnlyke culuour turtle chast birde hath name condition followeth chastity léeseth make seekth cōpanye goeth alone hath minde fellowship yt lost groneth alwaye loueth chooseth solitarye place flyeth much company men neuerthelesse commeth downe orchard garden feelds men eateth wherby liueth hath meate hée passeth againe high hill priuie place wood hée commeth springing time warneth nouelty time groning voyce winter léeseth fethers hée hideth hollowe stockes summer springing time fethers spring againe hée commeth hoale hée hid séeketh couenable place stéede bréede among thick boughes trées harde stickes knottie shée maketh neast layeth egges therein sitteth abroode hath birdes féedeth nourisheth aristotle sayth turtle layeth egges twice springing time thirde time first egges bée corrupt turtle laye bréede fiftéene yeare lyght vppon slinking thing neyther vppon carrion meate eateth carrion meate birdes better defie also bloud right wing medicinable bloud swallowe culuour doue vulture chap 35 uolture hath name slowe flight isidore sayth plenteousnesse much flesh hée lacketh swiftnesse flight men tell treding medled yt conceiueth conceiued gendereth gendered without ioyning treading tell live hundred yéeres isidore sayth birde cruell owne birdes kite shée séeth birdes fatte shée beateth féete bill make leane sore beating biting plinius saith also sayth birde wit smelling best therefore smelling sauoureth carrion bée farre beyonde sea againeward therefore uulture followeth hoast hée maye féed himselfe carrion men horse therefore diuinour sayth many uulturs come flie together betokeneth battaile know battaile shall bée priuie wit kinde aristotle speaketh uulture saith fighteth gentle falwcon slyeth hée hath ouercome dieth eateth rawe flesh therefore fighteth foules meate hée hunteth middaye night resteth still sunne rising time hée ageth ouer bill waxeth long cr • oked ouer nether dyeth last hunger aristotle sayth men saye errour olde time uulture sometime man cruell pilgrimes therefore hée hath paine bill dieth hunger lawfull beléeue saith meat leaueth reliefe hée leaueth foules eagle doth layeth neast féede bird getteth ligthly meate theyr neasts high mountaines thick woodes séeth fowle flye birdes beateth away féedeth bird till may flye driueth neast suffreth come nigh place also lib de almacar sayth ther manner water foule dreadeth uulture therefore flyeth water uulture flyeth farre thence sharpe sight waiseth foule cōmeth water taketh foule may also uulture much stinking foule vncleane flesh hard euill sauour heauye smell therefore profitable man meate carrion lighteth lyghtly ground alighted vnueth riseth againe frō ground gregory sayth hée flyeth high séeth carrion bée full lowe loue carrion commeth downe high country aire grounde sayth beast setteth vpon beateth wing winde riseth ground flyeth aire helpe winde owne strength héereto lib 29 ca 3 plinius saith among foules uulture contrary serpent fethers burnt smell thereof driueth awaye serpent heart thereof maketh man siker safe brareth among serpent wilde beastes heart bound lion skinne wolfe skin driueth away féends fethers bounde lefte foote woman trauaileth childe deliuereth swiftly must taken away lightlye least entrayles followe come ointment made uultures grease oile called oleum myrti waxe helpeth sinewes beast also right foot bound left foote healeth aketh left foote also healeth right foote tongue plucked yron hanged man necke new cloth maketh man gracious get mā bright cleane held owne markes bond water shuld shed fall naught except stopped held mark bond owne exameron basilius describeth ye property water general saith among element water profitable water maketh heauen tē perate earth plenteous incorporateth ye aire vapour maketh 〈1 page duplicate〉 〈1 page duplicate〉 thicke stieth vp high chalengeth heauen water cause al bred springeth bréedeth corne fruit bringeth forth trées hearbs grasse wipeth filth washeth awaye foulenesse giueth drinke man beast water ioyneth ye earth pearceth filleth nourisheth heat heauen tempereth al ye nether thing neather thing tē pered mouing burne wasted strēgth heat water dronke beast leadeth forth meat feeding liuing flesh giueth spirit breath fish aire giueth beast ioyning bodie soule shed inner part earth ioyneth ye part therof strength great drines ye earth shuld fal pouder partes ioyned together moisture water also passing inward way ye earth taketh changing likenesse coulour sauour place passeth therfore water séemeth salt sweet fresh cléere troublous thicke thin water hath determinate quality colour sauour ye intent shuld able take easily coulours sauours therefore ye cleane pure ye water ye dark dim seemeth ye sun beames come therein giue colour hew moueth ye middle toward vtter roundnes stinteth till vtter partes thereof made euen part therof like far middle point ye earth also taketh light sun beames reboundeth againeward toward heauen hath ye vtter part mirrour sheweth kinde working light rebounded likenesse image thing séene therin face looke therin knowen séene therin mirrour also sheddeth abroad beames thirleth substaunce thereof spreadeth largely breadth therefore maketh thing séene therin seeme themselues generall property water many thou maist find exameron many diuerse water saith water springeth cōmeth aire raine water heuenly water profitable thing grow earth water spring walme ye inner part ye earth well water pit water water passeth rūneth earth water riuers water beclippeth féeds earth ye roundnesse thereof sea occean middle earth mother generall head spring water constantine sayth raine water selfe bright cléere thin light sauourie cléerenesse therof sheweth none thing meddeled therewith lightnesse sauourynes sheweth subtill substance thereof among al water best plenteousnesse ye earth namely falleth thunder mouing thunder smiteth vapour maketh water subtill cleere pure cleane water medled snow molten snow worse good fasting smiteth stomake riueth togethers bréedeth cough setteth téeth edge constantine saith diuersitie water diuerse qualitie working thereof séeke lib 6 drinke chap 31 yée shall finde plainely declared open raine water well water best namely spring stone fall downe high well wel head spring liuing water springeth runneth continually priuie veines earth therefore well called fons fouens nourishing fundens shedding isidore sayth hath priuie comming veines earth hath springing rising daye wayes stone well multiplyeth water communicatiueth himselfe hée hideth himselfe nothing communicatiueth parteth himselfe well pilgrimes straungers men countrye also cleanseth himselfe thing well water runneth sad stone cleere cleanseth filth hoare also also well renueth himselfe altreth thing helpeth alwaye renueth water giueth benefice renuing altring thing plunge thēselues welles glose sayth super psa also abateth thirst cooleth refresheth wayfairing men heate giueth thirst drink contrary heate drinesse also well maketh place plenteous yt bée nigh thereabout place nexte well commonly haue mo hearbes grasse floures fructuous thā also well middle therof springeth first vp earth casteth away selfe pouder grauell yt way well springeth walmeth vp violence mouing passeth ye earthy part departeth dealeth part part sheddeth sparpleth asunder also well cléerenesse myrrour sheweth shape likenesse thing afore therfore men looke well sée therin theyr owne face well riuelyng speckes defile fairnesse seene water well also well qualytie time winter summer chaungeth owne qualitie macrobius saith winter well hot cold summer time cause therof winter heate flyeth voideth master contrary draweth inward inner part well presence heate continuall beating mouth well hot contrary summer contrary cause heate yt hath masterie aire summer coldenesse flyeth inner part wayes veynes wel therefore water springeth found cold time also highnes place ye springing water well sendeth water ye water led high pipe ye place spring water springeth well springeth ye top hill oft pipe water led ye highnes another hill led higher springing place except violence also though well little owne spring yet springeth continuallye originall cause manye great riuers riuer springeth well knowen vnknowen isidore saith also well amendeth water lake standing water quickning thē vertue wel litle springeth passeth great lake maketh water therin ye wholsome fish yt therin ye better point state also well taketh receiueth heat vertue sauor way veines ye earth yt passeth isid saith therfore well hot colde smelling brimstone ye diuers quality earth passeth isid saith li 12 italy well water thereof ofte healeth sore eyen also affrica well water thereof maketh voyce well sownding singing also boetia two welles one maketh good minde maketh forgetfulnesse also aethiopia well red colour drinketh thereof shall anone wood mad also cecilia two well one thereof maketh female barren maketh barren able conceiue also idumea well chaungeth colour foure time yeare thrée moneths séemeth troublous tempered powder thrée month red bloud thrée month green thrée month manner blue men countrie call well iobs well also siloa foote mount sion well runneth alway certaine day houres also sardinia hot well helpe eyen reproue théeues euill maketh knowen blindnes also saith yt egipt well ye burning brondes quenched quenched bronds kindled also among garamantes well cold day may dronk hot night may touched huc vsque isidore héereof followeth well hath sauor kinde owne ground ground swéete pure water shall also swéete pure againward also ground brimstonie slimie water shall sauour brimstone slime well spring corrupt vicious runneth vicious corrupt additiō englande water cure lame diseased bathe saint anne buckstone newman regis ¶of pit water cap 2 pit called puteus puteus lake digged dolue hath name puteus potus drinke isidore sayth sweating wosing clyues dennes earth water springeth small inner veynes earth broke water wose smoking wosing pit water gendered saith constant saith among water pit water thickest worst defie saltnesse earth standing water also déepnesse farnesse aire riuer side pit water soone found substance water likened complection riuer water pit nigh another deeper pit draweth water pit lesse déepnesse gathereth water selfe taketh sauour earth ground therefore water shewed salt fresh also pit water ofte taketh corruption moued therefore make pit water cleane pure néedeth oft moued drawen néerer pit water veyne earth colde fresh commonly water found also winter seldome neuer pit water fréeseth presence colde aire winter time heate contrary colde put inner part pit therefore water therof changed hot vapor suffered freese founde hot winter summer also déepnesse place pit water got difficultie vnneth caught drawen without great triall crafte ¶of riuer cap 3 riuer called flunius hath name affluendo running isidore saith euerlasting running runneth continually ceasseth runne head thereof stopped turned let know riuer euerlasting running déepnesse place winding turning mouing ofte riuer runneth ful long space country land also ye head knowen ye well spring finall end whetherward runneth maner springing euery riuer commeth originally sea priuie wayes springeth well head passe oft sea way passage knowen glose sayth super eccle pri sayd riuers runne sea ierome sayth thus philosopher tell swéete water runne sea consumpt wasted heate sunne el foode nourishing saltnesse sea ecclesiastes maker water sayeth come agayne priuie veynes earth well heades commeth mother sea walmeth springeth well heades also considered riuer corpes mouing betwéene beginning ende also sauour swéetnesse riuer water driued end clensed veynes wels passeth spoiled saltnesse taketh fauour able dronke turneth sweéetnes isidore saith also sight faire cléernes thereof considered substance thereof taketh lyght cléere myrrour image thing obiect thereto seene water riuers also touching substaunce riuer cleannesse purenesse considered course thereof downward swift swiftnes vertuous beareth downe let findeth course nothing withstandeth rauishing thereof swiftnesse beareth forth course throwen therein el driueth ye brinke brimme moueth beareth shippes laden putteth foorth course moueth turneth full swiftly full heauie whéeles violence strength taketh himselfe hoare filth throwen therein swiftnesse moouing departeth disperpleth filth hoare riuer clenseth selfe place passeth reneweth water lake pond commeth kéepeth corruption féedeth nourisheth fish diuers kindes clenseth doth away stench euill sauour changeth ye quality fish lake march also touching effect riuer hath many profitable thing couenable vse men warneth nothing benefice cō muneth men much selfe serueth euen lyke men beast lesse cleanseth doth away filth vncleannesse body cloathing refresheth cooleth hot féedeth drinke thirst moysteth maketh plenteous place nigh thereto influence humour moysteth rootes féedes maketh great fat fareth aegypt séedes lye sowen garden fieldes take moysture riuer nilus rabanus saith super deut cap 11 course city wardeth strengtheneth dwelling place bringeth city victualls merchaundises maketh men rich gathereth together heapes grauel earth maketh ilards also couenable place succour strength constantine speaketh riuer water saith riuer water best runneth eastwardthose spring vvhose current tovvard ye rising sunne wholsomest vvaters springeth commeth high mountaines riuer water runneth west warde lesse worthy also sayth farther riuere city cleane pure couenable féeding fish also filth hoare city cast riuers washing bathing siex thing riuer water sometime taketh corruption saith riuer water good runneth swiftly strōgly vpon smal stone grauelly ground vpon clay ground sad sauory cleere taketh sauour coulour ground passeth therefore well name property riuers diuers glose saith 〈…〉 per gen 2 though riuers haue cō mon head spring sea yet neuerthelesse place 〈◊〉 springeth vp country passeth taketh sauour colour name though riuer taketh self many water streames run thereto yet long proper well springeth lake léseth soone first name corporeth ioyneth himselfe water runneth therto name substance therefore though riuer little small beginneth spring first well yet ye farther passeth frō head spring wexeth running comming water streames doth danubio riuer germany yt called downow ye cōmon speach wherof isi li 13 speaketh saith yt riuer springeth cōmeth ye hils germany ye west side litle well runneth eastward taketh selfe lx riuers falleth sea named pontitū 7 mouth alwaies alike riuer profitable hée passeth bond brinke border brim sometime great raine melting snow water ariseth passeth chanell brimmes ofte destroyeth drowneth playnes countrie nigh riuers two manner kindes isidore sayth one called lyuing riuer whereof virgil saieth donec flumine viuo abluero c maner riuer called torrens water commeth swift réese passeth called torrens increaseth great raine fadeth drye weather gréekes gaue thereto name winter increaseth gaue thereto name summer falleth dryeth course water full swifte strong therefore ouerthroweth beareth downe méeteth selfe swifte strong mouing runneth breketh earth diggesh maketh dennes therein gathereth strawe stone heape leaueth behinde marke token destroyeth way drowneth thing nigh therto falleth sea ¶ amnis riuer cap 4 amnis riuer arayed sette wood groues trées bush isidore saieth hath name amnis amenitate mirth place mery ther grow medicinable hearbes great plentie wilde fowles nestle breed ye course streame thereof wilde beastes take drink coole themselues burning heate nigh thereto léeses pasture great plentie long verdure faire greene riuers holy writ maketh speciall mention phison gion tigris dorix euphrates iordan phison riuer called ganges also isidore saith lib 13 hath name ganges king called gangantes riuer commeth paradise passeth lande eiulatha countrey inde called phison yt vnderstand fellowship taketh selfe ten riuers also phison vnderstand changing mouth chaungeth qualitie hath paradise thrée manner wise master saieth historijs colour cléere dimme wher troubly quantitie wher little wher huge great wide straight feeling colde hot riuer much golden grauell manye precious stone also cliffes brimmes thereof grow trées hearbes swéete smellyng medicinable amnus riuer iland dolica arabia addition ¶of riuer gion cap 5 riuer gion called nilus also riuer mesopotamia commeth paradise called ioyning earth earthye troubly carthic slimie wosie ariseth far athlante passeth land aethiopia commeth downe aegypt moysteth playnes thereof super amos saith vpon word defluit quasi riuus aegypti riuer nylus disposition god moysteth aegypt yeare heapes grauell close mouth therof falleth inth • sea moysting lande heapes grauell diuide fall away nilus turneth againe owne chanell passeth sea swallowed sea last riuer nilus féedeth norisheth many manner créeping venemous beast noyfull grieuous crocodile little beast called enidros isidore li 12 ca 2 saith beast enidros little beast hath name enidros dwelleth water namelye riuer called nilus little beast findeth crocodile sléeping walloweth wrappeth himselfe first senne wose commeth mouth crocodile goeth wombe renteth gut slayeth • yeth also sup eccelesi 24 glose saith gion riuer nilus troubly draweth much slime wose slyme wo • e beareth course maketh land ouerpasseth full plenteous corne fruite additiō gyon called nylus famous great riuer running thorough aethiopia aegypt supposed bée one riuers paradise called holye scripture gehon signifieth breast slowing foorth creature nourished milke soyle ouerflowing valleyes albeit seemeth vnlykelye forasmuch genesis written gehon inuironeth aethiopia mention made passeth aegypt albeit ye aegypt riuer nilus nigh moses wrote booke genesis aethiope also nilus famous vertue water thereof ouerflowing countrey aegypt made ye ground wonderfull fertill many yeares without labouring ye earth brought forth abundaunce sundry graines plant delectable profitable also beastes sundry kindes without forme generation especially riuer came deepenesse 40 cubites likewise exceeded eight cubites succéeded much famine scarcitie cooper dictionarie nilus famous riuer world time sunne tropico cancri vntill come vnto equinoctiall line libra againe huge aboundaunce water doeth ouerflowe downes playne countryes aegypt altitude deepenesse floude aegyptians foresee plentye scarcitye fruites come polidore virgil first booke xv chapter ¶of tigris riuer ca 6 tigris riuer me 〈…〉 commeth paradise passeth foorth assyries isid saith passeth red sea many turning winding hath name tigris strong reese swiftnesse beast called tigris runneth great swiftnesse iosephus sayth tigris ariseth armenia well euphrates ariseth called tigl • th tigris •• risieth • ellan arrow ••• vnderstand sharp straight runneth straightly sharply arrow therefore ye language persia tigris swift arrowe one additiō mightie riuer runneth toward ye east side assyria gen 2 ca ¶of euphrates riuer cap 7 evphrates riuer mesopotamia commeth paradise copious gem precious stone runneth middle babilon riuer hath name plenteousnesse hebrue euphrata meane fruitfull runneth place mesopotamia moisteth land like nilus doth aegipt salustius certaine authoritie sayth tigris euphrates spring well armenia passe forth diuers place betweene two space lande manye mile land two riuers beclippeth called mesopotamia huc vsque isid lib 13 cap 1 ¶of riuer dorix chap 8 glose super eccle 14 saith dorix riuer hath another name called ar • xi ar • psi riuer armenia riseth commeth hist euphrates hath yt name swéetnesse might ouercommeth throweth downe thing waye isidore saith libro 13 alexander would passe ouer made bridge theron riuer arose great strength violence brake despi • ously ye bridge riuer ariseth lyttle head euphrates runneth thence sea called mare caspuim isidore saith called dorix among gréekes part lande countrey riuer runneth language called lingna dorica glose saith super ecclesiasticum 14 riuer seemeth arme tigris el euphrates el eyther springeth riseth well armenia therefore sayd hath plentie precious stone wel sauoring hearbs couenable medicine dorix vnderstoode medicine generation also saith commeth paradise mouing tigris euphrates ¶of iordane cap 9 iordane riuer iurie hath name two wels one tailed dan isidore sayth li 13 ariseth vnder ye hil mount libani departeth araby iurie passeth many winding iericho runneth dead sea therein swallowed wasted wheate ripe oft ripeth palestine springing time riuer ofte ariseth time falleth much raine melting snowe sayd histor •• glosa super iosu 3 sayde iordane filleth drinkes brimmes chanell reaping time c •• ecclesiasti 24 sayd sayth water taketh springing running thereto passeth thereof place fish lake constantine sayth good riuer fish wose slime hée maketh fish breedeth therein smell slime fish lake breedeth superfluitie hearbes grasse nourisheth frogges many wormes running water commeth lake maketh water fresh keepeth corruption ofte great comming water lake pond broke hath bene long time therein nourished sodainly destroyed lake water thick riuer water worse drinke drinke oft taken gendreth bréedeth many euills body said li 5 drinke lake water taketh diuers vertues place ground gathered isidore sheweth ensample
