deuoure anone beast take kéepe pray lorde holde content bowelles vile partes bloud theyr portion part though haue parte praye one beast yet spare pursue take another de alijs proprietatibus canum chap 27 goundes haue propertyes full good hound haue continuall bolisme immederate appetite sometime punished hunger waxe rabbish mad houndes haue sicknesse euilles baldnesse squinatye madnesse astotle sayth libro 7 beastes bitten mad hound waxe madde except men alone scape sometime helpe medicine constan sayth viatico li viti hound kindly cold dry blacke cholera hath mastrie cholera much rotted corrupt maketh hound madde falleth haruest springing time hound flye voyde madde hound pestilence venim alway exi • led outlawe goeth alone wagging rowling dronken beast runneth yaning tongue hangeth mouth driueleth foameth eyen v euertourned reared eares lie backward faile wrickled legges thighes though eyen bée open yet hée stumbleth spurneth thing barketh owne shadow houndes dreade flie barke hound come nigh bread wet bloud wounde biting bée bitten dreame theyr sléepe dreadfull dreames bée afearde sléeping commeth rottennesse corruption wroth astonied without cause looke beholde aboute • though nothing grieueth eulil increase begin dreade haue abhomination drinke dread water barke houndes dread water fall dreade die sooner holpen medicine cure remedyes looke libro de morbis cap de veneno libro 29 plinius sayth vnder houndes tongue lyeth worme maketh hounde madde worme bée taken tongue euill ceaseth also sayth violence biting madde hound much vrine grieueth man treadeth thereon namely hée haue botch wound also throweth owne vrine vpon vrine mad hound shall anone féele sore ach neather gut lends also hound wrathfull malicious awreak himselfe biteth oft stone throwen biteth stone great madnesse breaketh teeth grieueth stone owne téeth full sore also guidefull deceicable oft sickleth fawneth tayle men passeth waye though friend biteth sore take héede backewarde hounde hateth stone rod bolde hardye among hée knoweth busieth bite feare bold passeth among straungers also couetous gluttonous eateth therefore di ••• rde • gréedely yt perbraketh tasteth vp afterward • n hungred taketh yt cast vp foule manner also hound •••• tous therefore auicen saith yt gathereth hearbs priuely purgeth himselfe perbraking casting hath anuye right forrys man knoweth vertue hearbes also euill apaide straunge houndes vnknowne come place hée dwelleth breadeth least face worse hound presence fighteth therefore also hée couetous scarse busie lay vp hide reliefe leaueth therefore communeth giueth flesh marrow boanes hée maye deuoure houndes layeth vp busily hideth vntil hungreth againe also vncleane lecherous li 6 aristot saith hound male female vse lechery long aliue giue vncleannesse lechery yt take diuersitie betwéene mother sister bitch touching déede lecherie therefore offering price hounde bitch accounted vncleane law moses offering ye price common woman wretched person serue al lechery hound doe also olde hound oft slowe heauy libr 7 aristotle saith houndes age haue ye podagre scape euill therefore sleepe daytime vpon dunghill among flyes wormes fore grieued flyes theyr bleared eyen theyr scabbed eien though bite pearce somtime houndes eares yet slouth taketh comfort strength chase driue away vnneth flye agaynst face hée snatcheth mouth busieth bite téeth last scabbed hound violentlye drawen dunghill roape whippe bounde necke drowned riuer water hée endeth wretched lyfe skinne taken fleshe eaten buryed left finallye fly diuerse wormes catulis cap 28 whelpes called catuli bée child hound catulus nowne diminitiue catellus also manner misse vse young beast called catuli isi sayeth li 12 generally whelp bée whelped blinde touching perfect dooing sight hound whelp whelped sawing téeth though full small beast haue téeth like saw departed glutton fight hound woulfe lion yt panther beast gender vnperfect broodes said hand codem li de animalibus generali beastes bringeth forth vnperfect young cause gluttony shuld abide vntil ye whelp compleate perfect shoulde slay mother strong sucking therefore néedeth kind hastie spéedfull beastes looke eod lib solinus saith whelpes houndes worship among men old time plin saith li 29 ca 9 sucking whelp accounted pure good meat among men old time yt offred whelpes please god stéede beastes nothing accounted better profitable poison venim yet day author commaund take whelpes wholsomely venimous bitings whelpes opened layd hot biting serpent draw venim abate age maketh ye sore member whole remedy laid therto telleth sayth whelpes sooner bée whelped later haue sight nobler milke nourished slower receiue perfect sight yet blinde loue mother know voice odour séeketh teates happen mother withholdeth milke bite teates sharpest téeth compell mother giue largelye milke hungred cry whine séeke dammes teates also sayd sucke manner order lay bitch whelpe best strongest mother taketh first sucking loueth best comforteth meate shall bée withdrawne warilye wisely hunting houndes least waxe fat much meate great fatnesse take slouth slower praye running though melancholyke beast qualitie complection yet bée nimble swifte disposition member bée gladde mery play much theyr age bée weaned milke able taught hunting also playeng kéeping beast defend wolues houndes ordeyned kéeping house shoulde bée closed bound darke place daye stronger night cruell agaynst théeues office houndes rest sléepe daye wake night goe courtes close agaynst théeues hound blamed waketh barketh goeth daye sléepeth hideth himselfe barketh night also hounde euill hound whether hée bée young olde kéepeth wardeth shéepe defendeth wolues daye pasture strangleth biteth night folde castore cap 29 beauer castor wonderous beast liueth goeth land among foure footed beast swimmeth vnder water dwelleth fish swimme therin hath name castor castrando gelding isidore sayeth libro 12 gendering stone accorde medicine stone geld themselues ware hunter bite gendering stone hée sayth cicero speaketh sayth raunsome themselues parte bodye bée pursued iuuenal sayth geld themselues loose theyr stone desire scape castor called fiber also called sea hound pontus huc vsque isidor castoris plinius speaketh libro 11 capitulo 3 pontus hée sayth manner kinde beastes dwelleth lande water maketh house den arayed wonderfull craft brinkes riuers water beastes liue together flockes loue beastes kinde commeth together cutteth rod stickes theyr téeth bringeth hoame theyr den wonderfull wise laye one grounde vpryght stéed slead dray leg féete reared vpward lay loade stickes wood betwéene legges thighes draweth home den vnlade discarge make dwelling place ryght strong great subtiltye craft theyr house bée two chamber thrée distinguished thrée cellers dwell ouer place water ariseth neather water away hath certeine hole properly made celler hole putteth taile water taile fishy kind may without water long kept without corruption beast wonderfull wonderfully shaped taile onely fish deale bodye hath kinde foure footed beast shaped little hounde hinder feete bée féete hound therwith goeth principallye lande two fore feete goose féet therewith swimmeth principallye water skinne full precious hath téeth longer shorter hound swift moouing leg full short castor hath two gendering stone greate comparison little bodye call stone castorea stone plinius speaketh li 32 ca 3 sayth castor biteth gendring stone call castoria least taken hunter sextinus diligent sercher medicine denieth saith gendring stone cleaue nigh fast ridge bone yt may take beast life taken also also plat sayth dioscorides also beast wary witty could helpe himselfe yt manner known day castoris found diuers place isidore phisiologus tell gelding shall vnderstood cō mon castoris beast yt like castores gendering stone castorium feined helpeth greatest euill bodye plinius saith namely ye stone castor young olde castoria stone chosen manner double hang one string coupled one sinew may soone feined many men take ye bladder beast fill full castoris bloud put thereto little ye castor haue smel little pepper haue sharp sauour bindeth necke bladder séeme sinew impossible yt two bladder shoulde hang one neck therefore ye castorium best yt double hangeth one sinew ye castorium best meanly sharp sauour sharpe earthie feined namely haue sinewes medled diosc saith good castorium meanely sharp sauour glewie without strong salt sauour sal aromaticum oft castorium feined pli saith ther feesh new castorium better vertuous medicine token feined stone haue certeine skin yt cleaue essentially thereto full vnctuous fatnesse may kept seuen yeares greate vertue shall put medicine without vtter skin shal weighed due manner hath vertue dissolue temper consume wast abate euill humour namely comfort sinewy member castorium helpeth many sickness euills accordeth yt haue falling euill helpeth colde euills head doth awaye sodeine palsie tongue restoreth ye speech onely tempered moysture vnder tongue helpeth vniuersall generall palsie body sod wine rew sage oft meat drinke exciteth moueth comforteth brain maketh sneese therfore litargike man yt hath sléeping euill awaked therwith prouoketh causeth sléepe head anointed therwith oleum rosaceum helpeth strong venim venim scorpion serpent cerastes serpent prester plinius saith libr 8 cap 3 also vrine helpeth foresaid thing saith exciteth menstruall bloud helpeth conception many dooings grease effectuall vertuous ointment additiōthe beuer greate deuourer fish otter ceruo cap 30 hart called ceruus hath ye name cereston gréeke yt horne isi saith li 12 sayth hart enimies serpent féele themselues grieued sicknesse draw breath nosethrills theyr den mallice ye venim ouercome repaired féeding taught first vertue hearb diptannum eat thereof cast arrow arrow headsdiptanie diptā whē wounded hunter wonder noise pipe haue liking accord melodye heare well areare vp eares beare downe eares swim passe riuers great water swimming stronger swim féebles lay head vpon loines stronger swim may better indure trauaile huc v que isid plinius saith wordes lib 8 cap 34 sayth moreouer ye hart pleasing beast tunneth wilfully flieth man ouer set houndes hinde shall calue shunneth lesse wayes pathes bée troden wilde beast whether common priuy way rising starre arturus hinde conceiueth goeth calfe eight moneths calueth somtime two time conception female depart goe awaye male male leaue raging lecherie waxe cruell digge vp clot stone foot theyr snout black vntill washed raine caluing female purged vse certain hearbs ye calfe better held within wombe easilier deliuered calueth caluing ye female eateth two manner hearbes camum sisolis meaneth camamell spearwort name barbarous commeth againe calfe hath taken ye iuyce ye hearbe giueth calfe sucke maketh calfe vse run make ready flie leadeth high place teacheth leape male deliuered desire lechery eateth busilyealso vvild commin hée féeleth himselfe fat hée séeketh dennes lurking place dreadeth domage harme heauinesse body hart runne flie continue course look anon backward men come nigh séeke succour running flight heare cry hound eares reared vp flye fast perceiue perill eares hang downeward simple wonder thing bée astonied new sightes horse bugle come themward beholde earnestly take héede man commeth shoote swim ouer sea heards passe foorth euen order help come land sight smel hart horned beast among beastes hart hath propertie hée chaungeth horne euerye yeare springing time hée armourlesse séeketh day priuy place hideth vntill newe horne grow againe vntill hath horne armour casteth ryght horne enuie hée hideth sorrye anye man haue medicine thereof age harte knowen auntlers tine horne euerye yeare increaseth tine vntill seauen yeare tine groweth alike age may knowen thereby age knowen onely téeth hart hath téeth none hath tine neathermost parte horne forehead stande lesse tinescalled ye brovve antlets gelded afore haue horne afterward groweth horne gelded horne growen loose neuer theyr horne hée hornelesse hée goeth meate night daye putteth horne heate sun make sadde harde froateth afterwarde agaynst trées softly assay strength doth awaye itching féeleth therein hardnesse rinde féeleth horne strong goeth openlye meate léese sometime hée froateth trée compassed iuie weathwinde horne snarled fastened sometime taken hart contrary serpentes insomuch serpent flye voyde odour smell burning harte horne ruenning good agaynst biting serpentes hart liueth ryght long time passing hundered yeares knowen harte liued alexander time taken hundered yeares death alexander time marked cheines golde hart féeleth euill feauers hée succoured medicine agaynst euill huc vsque plinius libro 8 capitulo 38 aristotle auicen meane hart beast without gall onelye guttes hath therefore bitter gut stinking therefore hound eate guttes bée passing sore hungred also libro 2 aristotle saith men think harte gall loungs false auicen saith hath maner moisture like moysture gall also sayth hart bloud hare bloud coniealeth neuer alway thin fléeting kind beast beast chaungeth horne ceruus alone héere séemeth calleth ceruus hart bucke hart horne sound within therefore heauye changeth heauines hath foure great téeth one side foure grindeth therewith meate two great téeth tuskes male hath greater female bendeth downward auicen saith also libro octauo aristo saith men suppose hart hée among foure footed beastes vsing wood ready wise hinde calueth nigh waye beast spareth comming men flyeth light sunne hir calfe seeketh thicke place darke den caues stone haue one entering maye fight beast hée saith hart fight strong fighting ouercome right obedient victor dread voyce foxe hound sometime hart hideth himselfe least hunter finde slay fatnesse sayth hart hunted manner hunter whisteleth singeth harte hath liking therein another hunter tolleth inward shooteth slayeth hart areared flyeth riuer pond maye swim ouer water taketh comfort strength coldnes water scapeth hunter hart roareth cryeth wéepeth taken also hound followe findeth double wayes runneth foorthright hether thether leapeth thwart ouer wayes aside halfe purposeth take mightie large pace starteth contrary leaping starting harder houndes finde followe chase odour smel also saith ye hinde hath great trauayle payne calueth knowen bending crooking body ruthfull crieng therefore eateth hearbe dragantea delyuered hir calfe easelytarragō hath calued eateth sodaynly secundina bagge calfe ye mother ere fall ground secundina accounted venime sayeth aristotle libro 8 rehearseth property harte plinius rehearseth also li 28 pli saith hinde féeleth heauinesse swalloweth stone holp vertue stone stone sometime found hir entrayles dead accounted stone helpeth wonderfully woman goe childe doth boane found hir hart saith bone fonnde heart hart passing profitable many euils body medled noble confection dioscorides saieth constantine also additiōthe pisell hart dryed pouder dronke good collicke stopping water giue boane hart heart ground barren woman drinke thou shalt sée glory god gesner foorth galen stone great valew poyson called beswar stone gesner writeth hart sicke hath eaten manye serpent recouerie brought great heate hasteth water couereth body vnto eares eye time distilleth many teares sayd stone gendred c ¶of ceraste cap 31 cerastes horned serpent isidore telleth li 10 hath horne either side head crooked wrinkled horne ramme hydeth body grauell sand onelye leaueth horne vncouered foules sée think wormes lyght vpon intend feede themselues therewith false guylefull serpent taketh sodainly fowles ere bee ware also serpent lyeth waight wayes priuie place sueth men horse passe vnwarely wayes slayeth priuie biting glose super pen cap gines sayth séemeth cerostes manner kinde serpent malitious venemous onely venime toucheth horse hoose slayeth horse man therefore wher haue fiat dan sicut colubet via cerastes semita ye lether hath fiat sicut coluber via sicut regulus locato men meane cerastes manner serpent venemous malytious looke litera de aspide mention made cerastes additiō cerastes serpent verye lyttle bodie horne crooked lyke ramine ¶of cornu cap 32 cornu horne arist saith lib 3 kind bone softer boane harde gristells hooues clawes beast may bathed made softe fire sayeth colour horne sol beast colour haire body beast skinne blacke haire also horne blacke colour horne giuen beastes defend stéed armour weapon therefore set ye ouermost part head may alway ready withstand wrong enemyes horne voyde hollow within except hart horne hard sound within haue many tyndes auntiers beast chaungeth horne hart alone seemeth ceruus name hart bucke roe bucke hart changeth horn yeare hideth one vimeth may found therefore sayd 3 prouer go ye hart casteth horne libro 8 sayde horne faster ioyned skinne boane therefore arist saith beast moue horne well eares ye countrey called aufrage auicen saith aristotle sayth lande called matter matter horne hooues smoake passeth vapour resolued heate heart matter hooues horne const saith therefore beast hauing much aboundaunce smoke resolued departed right strong seruent heate hearte conuayed brought vnto vttermost partes bodye vertue heate suche beast haue great horne strong namelye smoakie matter subtill tourneth haire thicke earthy tourneth téeth tuskes therefore aristotle saith best libro tercio capitulo de dentibus beast teeth tuskes either iawe haue horn fareth elephant bore also foure footed beast téeth either iawe alone cloue fooled haue horne chewe cudde haue two wombes haue moe wombes sayde hande pluralitie horne follow clefte foote therefore asse inde called asinus indicus hath horne alone foure footed ari saith auicen also great affinitie betwéene houes clées horne aristotle commaundeth annoynt oyle medicine betwéene horne cow hath sore ache clées féete profit goodnesse horne treated litera b de boue additiōin olde time made horne beaten flat armour men diuers strange fashion shield target endes manye weapon armed therewith horne applyed many good v cunneyes generall newly added small beast bréeding warren parkes closure among v according soyle breed goodnesse flesh skinnes good furre especially blacke mixed white haires called siluer haires brought forth turkey cunnies called porcello indico haire short pigges haire reddish lyke rat indie connyes peter martyr description new ilandes writeth thrée sortes cunnyes whereof suppose best ¶of crocodilo ca 33 crocodilus hath name yelow colourcrocodilus isido sayth foure footed beast isidore sayth libro 12 capit de piscibus dwelleth water lande nigh twentye cubites long armed great teeth clawes skinne harde ye regardeth though strongly beaten backe stone resteth water night day land layeth egges lande greater goose egges male female kéepeth time houres certaine fish hauing creast lyke sawe renteth tender womb slayeth sayd among beast onely crocodile moueth ouer iawe isidore sayth plinius libro 8 ca 16 sayth maner crocodile beast dwelleth riuer nilus among beast land tonguelesse onelye ouer iawe moueth biting venimous teeth horrible strongly shapen combe saw bore tuske beast commeth lyttle beginning wexeth great crocodile beast nourished great gluttenie cateth right much full lyeth brinke cliffe bloweth fulnesse commeth little bird called cuschillus among called king foules among italian bird flyeth mouth sometime putteth bird last openeth mouth birde suffereth enter bird claweth first clawes softly maketh haue manner lyking clawing falleth anone asléepe bird cuschillos knoweth perceiueth beast sléepeth anone hée descendeth wombe foorthwith sticketh wer dart biteth full grieuouslye full sore crocodile right softe full tender wombe cause soone ouercōe fish haue sharpe prickes creastes growing backes high cause plinius sayth grim horrible beast followeth pursueth flye dreadfull flieth serpentes hath dimme eyen water séeth sharply water hideth winter namely foure month commeth springing time groweth still time alyue sayde huc vsque plin lib 8 cap 26 phisiologus saith crocodile findeth man brim water cliffe slayeth may wéepeth vpon swalloweth last plinius sayth dirte made oyntment oyntment woman annoynt owne face olde woman riueled séeme young wench time crocodile eateth gladlye good hearbes grasseenhydris vvater snake adder among lurketh litle serpent called enidros enemy crocodile hideth priuely grasse wrappeth himselfe therein crocodile eateth grasse swalloweth serpent serpent entreth wombe renteth gut slayeth commeth harmles also isidore saith libro 12 sayth worme lyeth awayte crocodile sléepeth wrappeth himselfe fen entreth betwéene teeth commeth body héereto solinus saith crocodile lyeth awayte certaine small birdes yt bréed among grasse riuer nilus birdes flye womb crocodile heate sunne eateth wormes wombe fierce beast cleansed purified wormes skin harde vnneth may pearced sword dwelleth lande day water night water hotter night daye water holdeth sunne beames moued water hotte beast hath tongue stretching outwarde make voice therewith hath lyttle tongue within fish haue tast sauour solinus sayeth aristotle auicen also additiōthe crocodill ill beast bred aegypt lyuing partly water land fashion lyke dragon small eye long teeth sharpe moueth onely vpper iawe hath great strong nayles clawes skinne vnpearceable scalye browne coloured deuoureth man beast comming nilus hath bene séene twentie foote long 22 cubites late yeares hath bene brought england case skinnes crocodile séene much money giuen sight thereof policy stranger laugh folly either wealthy else know bestow money ¶of colubro cap 34 adder called coluber wer colens vmbras dwelling shaddowes el hath ye name coluber slydeth wiggeleth slipperye draught wrinckles slimie passing slydeth helde called lubricum papias saieth adder coluber flyeth ye hind slayeth lyon isidore sayth eateth rew chaungeth skin loueth hollownesse woode trées drinketh milke busely hurteth grieueth téeeth tayle sheddeth venm lyeth sun vnder hedge sucketh bitch eateth flyes lycketh pouder looke de angue plinius lib 30 ca 4 saith greace water adder coluber helpeth biting crocodile man haue gall adder crocodil shal grieue noy ieoperdous fearfull beast dare maye doe manner wise dommage griefe beareth gall sayd adder additiōthe adder much vnlike water snake onely head flatter like newte skinne browne tayle hard tippe lyke spur young cocke verye venemous ¶of damula cap 35 damula dama also wilde goate papias saith libro 12 isid saith wild goate called damula fearfull beast dare fight cannot defend flight stéede armour wepon wilde goate hath ablenesse lightnesse runne fly marcianus sayth dente tuetur aper defendunt cornu ceruum imbelles damae quid nisi praeda sumus bore defendeth tuskes hart horne wilde goates fight pray wilde goate loueth mountaines woodes eateth medicinall hearbes grasse good smell gathereth biteth crop stalkes twig branch wounded eateth dragantea taketh arrow bodietaragon bloude thereof medicinall plin sayth libr 28 softneth sinew shronk doth away ache ioynts smiteth putteth venime serpent hate flye wilde goate may suffer breath hée saith goate sharpe sight swifte course running looke eodem de caprea agrosti ¶of dromedario cap 36 dromedarin heard kéeper dromedes dromedus manner kind camell isid sayth lib 12 saith dromedus maner kinde camell lesse stature camell much swifter course running hath therefore name dromedus swift running called drombs gréeke dromedus goeth hundred mile twentie ane daye beast cheweth 〈…〉 oxe camell dromedarri master dromedis properly speake papias saith glose super f •• 60 saith dromedarius dromis accounted beast lesse camell much swifte mudian epha countreys beyond arabia therin many dromedary ge •• th youth 〈…〉 runne auicen saith lest letted running desire liking female swifle reason long pa •• 〈…〉 haue large p • ce aristotle saith auicen plinith 〈…〉 also great heate hottest beast kinde complection strong heat consumeth land wastreth ventositie fastnesse suffereth 〈…〉 ouercharged much flesh fatnesse also ablenesse member legges long small full sinnewes therefore lyght able mouing strong continue course running light beast scarcitie meate beast much meate sufficed lyttle meate scarcely eateth heye rindes loueth well stoanes date content euen right long iourneyes plinius saith bloud full hot sharpe thin therefore milke dromedary full thin fléeting milk beast constantine sayth lesse nourishing heating departing thicke humoures looke de camelo hath nigh verye propertyes beast hath ¶of dipsade cap 37 dipsas dipsades feminine gender serpent called situla latine hath name sytula biteth dyeth thirst isidore saith libro 12 adder subtill small vnneth séene men tread venim slayeth felt vneth féeleth sorenesse shall dye manner kinde serpent sayde de aspide looke dracone cap 38 dragon called draco greatest serpent isidore saith lib 12 gréekes call draconia ofte drawen den réeseth vp aire aire moued also sea swelleth venime hath creast lyttle mouth draweth breath small pipe straight reareth tongue hath téeth lyke saw hath strength téeth also tayle grieueth biting stinging hath 〈…〉 serpent ende slay thing venime néedfull findeth slayeth elephant •• greatnesse body lurketh waye elephant goeth bindeth spanneth leg strangleth slateth dragon bréedeth • de aethiopia great burning continuall heat isidore saith li 12 plin li 8 ca 13 speaketh dragon saieth dragon xx cubites great bréedeth among aethiopes ofte foure fiue fasten theyr tayles togethers teareth vp head sayle ouer sea ouer riuers get good meate also cap 12 besayeth betwéene elephant dragon euerlasting fighting dragon tayle bindeth spanneth elaphaunt elephaunt foote nose throweth downe dragon dragon tayle bindeth spanneth elephant legges maketh fall dragon buyeth full sore slayeth elephant elephant falleth vppon slayeth irem ca 14 elephant séeing dragon vpon tree busieth break tree suite dragon dragon leapeth vpon elephant busieth bite betwéene nosethrile assayleth elephant eyen maketh blynde time leapeth vppon time behinde byteth sucketh bloude last long fighting elephant wexeth féeble great blindnesse insomuch falleth vpon dragon slayeth dieng dragon slayeth cause dragon desireth bloud coldnes elephant bloud dragon desireth coole himselfe isi saith super illum locum leuitic 14 attraxerunt ventum sicut dracones drew winde dragon ierome sayth dragon full thirstie beast insomuch vnueth may haue water inough quench great thirst openeth mouth therefore winde quench burning thirste wise therfore séeth ship sayle sea great winde flieth saile take ther cold wind ouerthroweth ship somtime greatnesse body strong réese saile shipmen sée dragon come nigh knowe comming water swelleth strike sayle anone scape wise also solinus saith aethiopians vse dragon bloude burning heate eate flesh diuers euills depart venimme flesh hath venim tongue gall therfore cut tongue throw away gall venime receiued venim taken away vse deale bodie meate medicine séemeth dauid toucheth sayth dedisti eum efcam populis aethiopium thou gauest meate people aethiopia also plin saith might venime tongue alway areared somtime setteth ayre fire heate venime séemeth bloweth casteth fire mouth sometime bloweth outragious blastes thereby aire corrupted infected thereof commeth pestilent euilles dwell somtime sea sometime swine riuers lurke sometime caues den sléepe seldome wake nigh alway deuour beast sowles haue right sharp sight sée therefore pray farre mountaines fight biting stroke stinging setteth eyen nose beast fighteth therefore plin saith li 8 hée grieueth elephant eyen mouth maketh ofte blinde sometime elaphaunt maye eate dyeth therefore wise also dragon arist speaketh lib 7 sayth dragon biting cateth venemous beastes perillous dragon biting eateth scorpion biting vnneth remedy medicine founde also lib 28 plinius sayth venemous beast flye voyd greace fatnesse dragon greace medled honnie cureth healeth dimnesse eyen also libr 7 aristot saith fish dye bitten dragon additiōof wonderfull greatnesse dragon manye sortes hath bene mischiefes haue done read chronicle doome ¶of equo chap 39 horse called equi haue name ioyned coupled carte chariot euen odde also coupled shape course also horse called caballus hath name hollow féete maketh therewith caue pit ground goeth beast haue suche féete isidore saith lib 12 among many men horse called sonipes foundeth féete horse ioyfull field smell battayles comforted noyse trumpet battaile fighting excited runne noyse know sorie ouercome glad haue masterie feeleth knoweth theyr enemy battaile farre foorth arise enimies biting smiting also know theyr owne lord forgetteth mildnesse lord ouercome horse suffereth man ride backe onely owne lord manye horse wéepe lord dead sayd horse weepe sorrow right man doth ye kind horse man medled centaures beastes also ofte men • sight take euidence diuine gesse shall befall sorrowe ioye horse maketh horse persia cicilia liue long time fiftie yeare horse gallia inde spaine line lesse time héereto isidore saith old men meane gentle horse noble men take héede foure thing shape fairenesse wilfulnesse colour shape strong sadde body according strength might height length breadth side long deale small loynes great thigh round large broad breasted body full sad full brawne foote drye hoofe hollow sad fairnesse knowen lytle head skinne cleauing nigh ye bone eares little sharpe eyen great nosethrills large beareth vp head maane thicke tayle long hoofe well pight round wilfulnesse knowen bold hart swifte féete ye member quake token strength soone areared riseth soone great rest el soone stinted swifte course running colour knowen coulour nowe red blacke nowe white nowe graye diuers speckeled diuers colour beautifieth much disfigureth horse token know strength horse pursue order make processe orderly long huc vsque isidorus libro 12 libro 7 capitulo 43 plinius speaketh horse saith horse scythia fight lordes eschewe ingender owne damme manner knowledge kinred aristotle speaketh héereof libro 8 sayth king north hadde fayre mare foaled faire horse king would haue colte gotten horse owne damme couered hir face mare head vncouered anone horse knew hir fled fell downe high place dyed sorrowe also company mare horse goeth gladly mare colt damme glad noyse simphonie trumpet starteth réeseth enemy bodeth warre fighting wéepeth friend lordes horse accounted best warre battaile thrust head déepest water drink meaneth horse bée let running heauinesse vrine also libr 28 cap 9 sayth gall horse accounted among venim therefore lawfull idolatrous priestes touche horse fresh bloud raw venemous bloud bull horse foame dronke ass milke slayeth venemous wormes also aristotle auicen meane ye horse casteth téeth elder whiter téeth also libro 5 aristotle saith male horse lyueth xxv yere gendereth thrée yeare xxv mare liueth longer gendereth xl yeare horse beginneth gender voyce greater fareth mare also loue worke generation beast sayth libro 5 also lib 7 saith sometime horse haue podagre loose soales theyr féete groweth new signe héereof quaking right gendring stone horse fed house haue euill called illiaca passio token therof hinder member crimpleth togethers constrayned horse tyed meate let bloud shall holpe also horse hath shrinking sinewes token therof veynes straight vppon head necke grieueth goe also horse gather venimme haue another euill mouth called forem token euil matter falleth roofe mouthe breath hot euill without remedy except heale himselfe somtime horse mad token token thereof eares bend toward necke euill hath medicine horse hath sickenesse bladder token thereof may pisse also draweth loynes sol also horse bitten grieuously flye called mugelis biting flyeasilus horse flye grieueth full sore horse mule maketh rise theron blain whelkeshirudo ye brent flye leache oftentimes horse dye venime thereof horse knoweth neighing fight hath lyking stand medes swim water drinke troublous thicke water water cléere horse stampeth stirreth foot make thick huc vsque arist lib 6 ¶of equa cap 40 mare called equa name commeth name equus li 7 arist saith mare foale smelleth snuffe candle casteth hir foale item idem mare go léese together one dye leaue hir colte aliue another mare feedeth nourisheth kind mare loueth beast ye kinde also libro 8 cap 42 plin saith mare foaleth standing loueth hir coltes passing beastes colte léeseth damme another mare feedeth nourisheth loueth hir owne also sayth forehead colte bréeddeth blacke skinne quantitie sedge mare lycketh hir tongue taketh away receiueth neuer colt suck hir teat except first taken away plyn calleth skinne veneficium amoris woman witch vse skinne charmings excite man loue also aristotle sayth mare proude hath ioye hir mane sory shorne hir maane short hir lyking lechery quenched though vertue loue wer maane also lib 8 arist saith birde called ibis fighteth horse horse driueth hir hir pasture léese ibis féeble sight hath voyce horse flyeth aboue horse stonieth maketh flye slayeth somtime additiōthat fable birde bignesse snype filthy stinking bird ¶of poledro ca 41 colte called poledrus pullus equinus also mare sonne hath name sucketh li 7 arist saith forhead foaled found iconemor called also amoris veneficium mare licketh hir tongue taketh away hydeth eateth woman witch haue prouerbes thereof saith also li 13 sayth hinder part colte former part colte wexeth former part wexeth vpward therefore manye horse former part higher hinder therfore colte maye touch head hinder foote maye age colte loueth damme wonderfull great affection followeth hir whereeuer goeth happeneth léeseth hir presently neigheth colte lyttered strawe curried horse combe arayed trapping gaye harnesse smitten spur sadled saddell tamed bridle followeth dam fréely eateth grasse féete pearred nayles suffered runne hether thether fréely last set worke trauayle helde tyed lead halter raynes taken damme may sucke dammes teates taught manye manner wise goe easely softe isi saith li 18 set carte charyots chaires trauell bearing horseman chiualry silly horse colte foaled diuers happes fortune isi saith eod libro horse sometime hallowed diuers vsage god chariot horse ordayned hallowed sunne foure chaunges sunne one yeare springing time summer haruest winter time chaungeth vertue sunne carte horse hallowed ye moone séene double time night daye therefore worship ye moone couple alway two horse white blacke thrée horse drew one carte hallowed god hel fiend draw men thrée age childhood youth age men coupled togethers horse diuers color durst well couple togethers past seauen horse lykened number seauen starres mouing seauen starres supposed generally world ruled el number seauen dayes passing seauen circle saye lyfe passeth endeth describeth therefore wonderfully colour horse isid sayth hallowed red horse firered white brovvne baye pale mouse dunne sunne white aire browne earth blew water sea rode red horse summer thing héateth white horse winter thing whiteth colde frost graye springing time thing wexeth gréene browne blacke haruest thing dryeth fayleth first fairnesse also ther saith ye halowed red horse mar named god battayle warre banner romanes wer dressed redde silke mar ioye lyking bloud hallowed white horse west countrey fayre weather gréene flower earth blewe sea water water blewish coulour hallowed yeolow horse horse diuers colour purpured rainbowe call arcum rainebow hath many colour cursed men vsed somtime procuring inticing fiend element world isidore saith therefore world dispised manie hath fulfilled lykenesse sathanas huc vsque isidorus libro 8 last take héede horse colte going pace hard softe easie vneasie vseth youth vnneth may leaue age additiōthe irish hobbie genet naples courser tartaria englysh stoned horse foure principall best kindes horse world flemish mare bréeding ¶of elephante cap 42 elephant called elephas elephantus also hath name elphio gréeke saye hill great quantitie body indie call barro therefore voyce called barritus téeth called ehur snowte wroote called promuscis proboscis therewith bringeth meate mouth isido sayth libro 12 sayeth beast sharpe wrath battayle uppon beast medes perses vsed fight tower trée threwe shot dart tower castle beast haue wit minde passing beastes goe feare manner going voyd flye mouse doe déede generation backward female foleth water wood leaueth hir foale foaleth dragon enemy spanneth slaieth goeth foale two yeares gendereth lyueth thrée hundred yeare isid saith li 12 lib 8 ca 1 pli saith among beast ye elephant vertue ye vneth among men great redines sound telleth ye new moone come together great company bath wash riuer come together new ye moone lot turne againe owne place make young go turning againe kéepeth busily teach wise sicke gather good hearbs ere vse heards 〈…〉 heaue vp head looke vp towarde heauen pray help god certaine religion good wit learne well easie teach insomuch yt taught know ye king worship busieth reuerence bend ye knées worship also ca 5 said elephant sée man comming way wildernes wold afray draw themselues somewhat way stint passe little little teach way dragon come fight ye dragon defend ye man put forth defend man strongly mightely doe namely haue young foales dred yt man séeketh foales therfore purpose first deliuer ye man yt may safely féed yoūg keep ye warely also li 8 ca 6 alway goe together eldest leadeth ye company next age helpeth shal passe ouer riuer water send ye yoūg lest ye foord let cōming ye elephant might passe conueniently also among strange shamefastnes one thē ouercome ye ouercome flyeth voice ye victor doe ye déedes generation priuy place ye male fiue yeres old female x yere two yeare telleth two yeare onely fiue day seldome sixt day saith full perillous time generation namely wilde elephant throw downe house stable indian therefore indian hide season tame female elephāts elephant bée best chiualrie tame beare tower tree throw scaffold ouerturne men armes wonderful dread men armes ranged battayle dread flye voyce least sounde swine also cap 40 forhead snowte throweth high palmes eateth fruite thereof also betwéene elephant dragon perpetuall wrath strife one hath enuie great might strength quantitie body dragon loueth drinke elephauntes bloude coole burning heate bloud colde sayde booke wher intreateth dragon looke ¶de naso elephantis chap 43 aristotle lib 1 auicen meane elephant nose long strong bolning harde horne vseth nose stéed hand thereby taketh meate drinke putteth mouth elephant hath two pappes breast strong tuskes mouth tongue full lyttle comparison bodye seene within seldome séene without lycketh lyppes meate drinke found one gut folden wrapped manye manner wise gut stéede stomacke therafter one dirte passeth hath great lyuer foure time greate lyuer oxe hath lytle mylte splene comparison body auicen sayeth melancholia humor passeth nourishing also li 7 arist saith gendred teeth gendered snowte nose hée wrooteth vp tree breatheth therewith swimmeth casteth water harde snowte calceus made hard gristle elephant sitteth bendeth foot may bend foure heuinesse waight body hee leaneth right side lefte side sléepeth standing bendeth hinder leg right man also libro 5 male gendereth fifthe yeare female tenth vnto fortie yeares resteth hath foaled thrée yeares hath conceiued toucheth male gorth fole hir wombe two yeares foale foaled lyke calfe two thrée month olde also lib 6 elephaunt hath sicknesse commeth ventositie winde sicknesse may pisse shite eateth earth dyeth vsed therto somtime swalloweth stone hath also ache ioyntes thereagainst helpeth drink colde water grasse hearbs plunged honie two thing letteth fluxe womb ache sore may sléep sholders must balmed oyle hot water thereby holpe doth swine flesh rosted laied bound shoulder aketh hath yron bodye oyle giuen drinke yron drawen oute drinking oyle may drinke oyle medicine sodden oyle giuen eate also libro 8 saith male body bolde hardie female male tamed beating beaten obedient hunter sitteth vpon hunter lighteth downe fore feete bée bound vntill tame booke littera f followeth able tamed obedient wilde beastes hath wit feeleth colde winter colde winde beast vseth much water riuers dwelleth beside riuers wadeth water vnto chinne swimmeth may dure long swimming heuinesse bodye elephauntes bée without gall aristotle sayeth libro 14 accidentallye cruell fierce bée soone angred wine dronken make sharpe fight battaile also li 18 aristo saith beast lyueth long elephant complection lyke ayre dwelleth néedeth goe foale two yeares greatnesse foale may perfectly complete shapen lesse time additiōthe elephant foure footed beast next vnto man perseueraunce indian bring warres put great packsaddle backes italy vse great mule girde two chaynes yron stéede girts upon saddle place little turret cage made woode euery turret containeth thrée men betwéene turret sitteth indian backe beast speaketh language lycour salute welcome rising sunne certaine mouings may tourne againe woodes landes youthe knowen whitenesse téethe téeth one alway working spared least hée shoulde wexe dull continuall smiting washing bathing fight neuer female knowe spouse breache fight case sull busie helpe hurte wounded middle among defend themselues taken made tame mild barley caue ditche made vnder earth pitfall elephaunts waye vnwares falleth therein one hunter commeth beateth smiteth pricketh full sore another hunter commeth smiteth first hunter doth away defendeth elephaunt giueth barley eate hath eaten thrice foure time loueth defended afterwarde milde obedient happeneth swalloweth worme called camelion taketh eateth wilde olyue tree holpe agaynst venimme wombe softe ridge harde therefore fighteth unicorne putteth foorth backe least sticke horne softe bellye hath lyttle hayre bristelles large eares long thinne hanging downewarde hée réeseth smiteth therewith full sore wrath dragon hée hateth walking wood called satiri may haue inough lechery isid saith though beast vse reason mankinde yet bée like mankinde voice manye déeds isi saith li 11 de protentis sayth satiri somewhat like men haue neuertheles slie busie many great beast make purueyaunce wisely themselues whereby maye lyue time come afterward lyue company make heapes hill inhabit themselues gather gréenes busily properly put inner closet full waxilye taken away foules spilt shed winde weather maketh priuy wayes euen straight house dwell wiser ant stand way vnwiser goe waye bée ouerset theyr house taken shed venimous water vppon menthey haue sting ye bee smal vvherewith sting therefore commonly sayd yt hée pisieth water burneth hand toucheth bréedeth therin itching smarting haue water stéed weapon armour huc vsque solinus libr 11 capitulo 31 plinius sayeth ante communeth trauaile séeke gather theyr owne meate bées bée better ante bées make good meate profitable gather doe together ant gather great burthen greater theyr owne bodyes recouer reward littlenesse bodye greatnesse vertue beare theyr charge burthen biting great may beare mouth tourneth busieth drawe forth hinder féete take greate charge common profite haue therefore season winde shale graines togethers shuld growe agayne waxe gréene corne gather busily graines shed bée lost entering breake greater grain maye easilye bring place purueyaunce worke night full moone cease worke chaunge moone bring fetch theyr meate diuerse place haue certaine time giuen thē knowledge gathering meeting among meete manner treating talking busie king spyeng softeneth carueth harde adamant stone neyther fire yron may ouercome said goate bucke called also caper hath name capio take bée laboureth take croppes trées goate bucke beginneth bée mooued gender one yeare aristotle sayth li 6 male first gendered great fat bée gendered afterward also libro 7 sayth goate buck haue notable hugenesse eares rammes haue theyr tailes haue bredth thē breadth hound goate bucke hath long beard small taile long downe earth many strong great horne rough wooll hard stinking smell hath much fatnesse namelye within reines dyeth lightly excepte fatnesse bée withdrawen fat lesse semen hée hath gendereth lesse • hée sayth lib 8 hee doeth déede generation seldome therefore wise heardes slayeth ere doe déede generation else suffer bée leane maketh bée leane though hée séeme leane without yet sometime full fat within oft happeneth goat bucke wonderfullye shapen aristotle sayeth libro 8 sometime happened goate bucke séene horne legges wonderfull sée among flesh beast flesh goate buckes worst hardest worst defie isaac sayeth dietis namely goat buck right olde skinne olde goat bucke better stronger young odour smell flesh worst hée bée gelded fleshe moyst tender lesse harde defie lesse euill eaten also libro 28 plinius sayth democritus sayeth goate bucke neuer without feauers bloud goat buck sedde iuie breaketh wonderfully stone bledder reines saith horne burnt feareth chaseth away serpent healeth feauers canker fretteth awaye cleanseth polipus superfluitye flesh nose liuer goat bucke helpeth agaynst biting madde houndes gall cléereth sight fretteth awaye webbes cyen vrine meddeled gal helpeth leprous men doth awaye seales scab additiōdiuerse author affirme hot bloud goat bucke dissolueth flintstone softnesse de hiena cap 61 hiena cruell beast lyke woulfe deuouring gluttony réeseth dead men taketh sarcasse earth deuoureth thē therfore hath ye name hiena niando desire réeseth praye open mouth voyce kinde chaunge sexus nowe found male female therfore vncleane beast isidore sayth commeth house night seineth mannes voyce hée maye men thinke man libro 8 cap 30 plinius speaketh beast sayth hiena eyther kinde sayd one yéere mal •• e another yéere female bringeth furthher broode without male common people suppose aristotle denieth hath necke adder vipera ridge elephaunt may bend beare body heards tel among stable seyneth speach mankinde calleth man owne name renteth hath without feineth oft name man make bound run may take eat beast hath endlesse many manner diuerse colour eyen full moueable eyen vnstedfast shadowe maketh houndes leaue backing still come neere beast hiena goeth thrice anye beast beast shall stint within step beast gendereth lyonesse aethiopia gendereth beast cruell followeth voice men tame beast hath many rowes téeth euery side mouth affrica many hienas manye wilde ass fibre many beast wonderfully shapen plinius sayth beast hiena bréedeth stone called hiena man beareth vnder tongue shal vertue stone deuine tell shall befall solynus saythwhen get ye stone also libr 28 plinius sayth hiena hateth pantera sayd theyr skinnes bee hanged togethers haire pantheres skinne shall fall awaye beast hyena flyeth hunter draweth towarde right side occupy trace man goeth hée commeth telleth goeth wit el man falleth horse turne hiena ye beast soone taken magitians tell also sayth beast gall full medicinall helpeth dimnesse eien also witch vse heart beast licour many witchcraft sayd aristo li 7 sayth quantity hiena quantity wolfe neck haire necke horse hath haire vpon length ridge bequileth deceiueth men rauisheth stealeth taketh houndes deuoureth gladly men diggeth burialls graues eateth flesh dead bodyes additiōof hyena plinie maketh mention 8 booke chap 30 beast lyke woulfe mane like horse comming night vnto shepheards house counterfeit mannes voyce harkning learne one name call forth end deuoure gesner doubtfull whether beast yet hath set downe author hiricio cap 62echino irchin called hiricus hedghoy beast couered prick hard sharpe skinne cloased pike prickes hée cloaseth himselfe therwith defendeth himselfe therewith anone knoweth féeleth anye thing commeth areareth vp prick wrappeth therein clew within armour beast purueyaunce climbeth vpon vine apple trée shaketh downe grape apple bée feld walloweth sticketh prick thē aud beareth meat young manner wise isi saith li 12 roughnesse sharpnesse prick pike called hirenacius hiricius hath aristotle saith li 1 pike stéed haire pi • héeleth haire beast weapon armour stingeth pricketh hurteth taketh toucheth also li 3 aristotle saith yt irchins dwell wood place land water lay many egs eaten irchins haue lyttle flesh propertye hée hath beneath head mouth outpassing superfluitye aboue hée taketh meate beaneth hath therefore hoale side superfluity • ridge aboue irchin hath fiue téeth within mouth hath amonge téeth fleshy part stéed tongue wombe departed fiue part therin much superfluitie manner kind irchins white shell white pike layeth many egges also irchin hath feeble hearing feeble beast hard shell goe foure féete also libro 5 wilde irchins gender standing back turned backe part yt superfluitie passeth touch themselues generation also li 8 said yt often séemeth irchins wit knowing cōming wind north south maketh den ground ware windes come sometime one constantinople yt irchin knew warned therby windes shoulde come side none neighbour wist whereby knowledge warning also li 12 sayth irchin hath also many wombes téeth wombes bréedeth fiue egges better egges bee much greate lesse bée better séething defieng also li 19 irchins haue little body many pike occupye place bodye cause many great prickes littlenesse body féeding bodye passeth nourishing growing pike scarcity heat meat well defied therfore bodye breedeth much superfluity superfluity passeth nourishing feeding prickes huc vsque arist additiō histrix porcapine like vnto hedghog stronger armed prickes bigger bodyed herinacio cap 63 common hedghog herinacius cirogrillus little beast prickes dwelleth den lyke irchin accounted lib 8 cap 38 plinius speaketh sayth hée walloweth vppon apple irchin doeth sticke thereon prickes beareth hallownesse trées beside apple beareth backe alway beareth one mouth hunted cloaseth rounde hall nothing touch pike prickes trusteth scape hée casteth pissing venimous pisse grieueth himselfe first cōmeth wise back prick moisture pisse back smarteth grieueth also prickes backe fall away therfore knoweth yt thereby sooner taken hée casteth grieue therefore craft hunt little beast vrine spent wasted backe hurt broken prick pike loose fall may flie knoweth smell kindlye vrine strength venim hid spareth therfore vrine doth away sheddeth venim ere last néede taking cōpell thereto though beast little yet dreadeth constraineth himselfe fast vnneth may opened streighted sauing skinne therofore put hot water openeth himselfe sodeinly hée seeleth heate bounte hanged vp hinder feete hanged slayne hunger otherwise hée maye slaine good manner haue good profite féeble skinne though little body beast full necessary vse mankinde yet skin yt picked needfull men pike prick softnesse flesh beast idle mankinde beast skinnes clothes cleansed picked said beast herinacius hath property yt charged grape apple apple grape fall pike maner wise indignation throweth away backe deale oft turneth agayne trée charge agayne new charge ¶of iuuenca cap 64 ivuenca iuuencus young stéere bullocke able yoaked draw plough isido saith el hath name iuuencus old time young stéere offered iupiter bull sayth lecherous beast youth therefore ouerset strong yoke make easie tame pricked pricke compelled follow euen foreright step fore dren iuuenca young stéere ofte able coupling ioyning bulles age stéere ioyned bull drawe young cowe made fat léese pasture bée slayne batcher diuers vse mankinde hir flesh drye sad ye flesh sucking calues lōger without féeding milk tender hot moyst flesh olde oxe olde cow yet néerer age sucking age sayd dietis ¶of leone cap 65 leon gréeke called leo latine king english called leo king king prince beast isid sayth li 12 lion short crispe haire maane lion fight lion haue simple haire mane lion haue sharp fierce hart forheads tailes vertue known best stedfastnes ye head beset hunter beholde earth dread lesse hunter gin beset dredeth noyse rushing whéeles dreadeth fire much sleepe eyen open go forth heale bide fore step hunter finde supposed lion whelpe whelped sleepeth thrée dayes thrée night sayd place ye couch trembleth shaketh roring father waketh whelpe sléepeth kinde lion wroth man grieued hurt also mercie known many oft ensamples spare lye ground suffer passe homeward prisoner come thraldome eate man slaye great hunger huc v que isid li 12 li 8 ca 17 plin speaketh lion saith lion gentlenesse nobilite necke shoulder healed haire maane gendered parde lacketh nobilitie lion knoweth smell parde gendreth lionnesse réeseth lionnesse breaketh spousehood punisheth hir full sore except wash hir riuer knowen lion lionnesse whelpeth hir wombe rent clawes hir whelpes whelpeth therfore oft arist saith plin saith lionesse whelpeth first fiue whelp afterward foure yeare lesse one mereth barren whelpeth one last whelpeth whelpes euill shapen small quantitie wesell ye beginning saith also ye whelp vi monthes maye vneth whelped whelp 2 mōths may vneth moue lion heaueth leg pisseth hoūd doth vrine pisseth stinketh right foule ea • eth inough afterward meatlesse 2 dayes 3 néedeth flye ful casteth vp meate mouth draweth clawes wise light runne flye lion liueth long knowen working wasting téeth age réeseth man vertue might faileth pursue great beast wilde besiegeth city ransack take men lyon taken hanged lyon dread maner paine olde lyon réeseth woodly men onely grunteth woman réeseth seldome child great hū ger tayle boldnesse heart lyon knowen horse knowen eares lion wroth first beateth carthe tayle afterwarde wrath increaseth smiteth beateth owne backe eache wounde lyon maketh clawe téeth runneth sharp sower bloud isido saith also perrill lyon gentle noble pursued houndes hunter lyon lurketh hideth himselfe sitteth fieldes may séene arayeth himselfe defence runneth wood couert swifte running course though would account vile shame lurke hide himselfe hideth himselfe dread hath dreadeth himselfe somtime onely would dread pursueth man beast land leapeth réeseth pursueth man beast vseth leape doeth voydeth flyeth wounded taketh wonderfull héed knoweth smiteth first réeseth smiter though neuer great multitude man shoote lyon chaseth throweth downe woundeth burieth lyon dyeth biteth earth teares fall eyen sicke healed holpe bloude ape dreadeth greatlye crowing combe cocke right kinde beast knoweth loueth doth good sayde ensamples plinius setteth huc vsque plin li 8 ca 12 li 2 arist speaketh lyon saith auicen saith also ye lion hath necke vnmoueable full grimme hath entrailes bowells hound moueth alway first right foote afterward lefte foote camell doth hath lyttle marrow bone bone hard smiting togethers sire springeth thereof also li 16 lyon hath many cleftes féete gendereth therefore blinde whelpes hound doth woolfe also hath sawie teeth gendereth therefore vnperfect whelpes hée sayth solinus also saith lyon dredeth séeth heareth whelpe beaten whelpes borne blinde ye whelpes beast haue féete departed whelped vnperfect gluttonie hideth himselfe high mountaines espieth thence pray séeth pray roareth full lowde voyce beast dred stint sodainly 〈…〉 maketh circle taile beast dread passe ouer line circle beast stand astonyed afeard abiding ye hest commaundement theyr king lyon passeth rough place hard clyncheth clawes draweth toward foote vseth stéede sword hideth therefore within softe place fleshie hurte made blunt ashamed eate alone pray taketh therefore grace free hart leaueth pray beastes follow farre saith hot complection hath alway feauer quartane hath kindly euill abate fiercenesse flesh passeth heate therefore grieuous eating saieth plin libro 28 flesh good medicine many manner wise greace contrarie venimme anoynted therewith shall dread time biting serpent créeping wormes also greace medled oleo rosaceo kéepeth saueth ye skin face wennes vice kéepeth whitenes healeth burning swageth swellyng eyen gall medled water sharpeneth cléereth sight helpeth infecting euills falling euills heart taken meate destroyeth feauer quartane huc v que plin li 28 cap 8 lion hunted wise one double caue made one fast seconde caue set whitche cloaseth full soone touched first den caue lambe set lyon leapeth therein hungred take lambe séeeth may breake ye den ashamed beguiled would enter second den lurk falleth cloaseth anone letteth passe thereof kéepeth fast therin vntill taken bound chaines till tame toucheth ier super ezech cap 19 super illum locum miserunt cum caueam c additiōthe lion among hebrewes sayeth dauid kimht hath diuers name according degrées age first name gur second kephir thirde arieth fourth labi last laisch gur signifieth whelp euery beast yet commonly excellency sake put lion whelpe stymnos amōg ye gréeks kephir little elder arieth second chapter naum prophet lyon labi lionesse cepharim young lyon gur lyon whelpe contained one period lion drinketh seldome lyttle lyon sayd watching shut eye sléeping openeth héere vpon auncients paint vpon temple gate lion badge signe one sit vpon lion skinne emeroydes goe ¶de leena cap 66 lionesse called leena right lecherous beast loueth alwaye déede lecherie therefore cruell lyon namely hath whelpes putteth hir selfe perill death hir whelpes defence shée dredeth spareth shot hunter whelpeth moe whelp first whelping doeth afterward sharpnesse clawes hir whelpes hir mother grieued hurt yeare yeare shee wexeth barren aristotle saith plinius sayeth wise isidore saith lib 12 beast sharp clawes may ofte whelpe ye mother grieued hurt within moouing whelpes therefore lionesse may abide whelping vntill perfect complishment hir young delyuereth hir hir whelpes whelpeth ere hir young perfect complete compelled thereto great ache sorenesse feruent lecherie lyonesse meddeleth lecherie parde déed lechery ye parde dredeth lion ye lyon knoweth fowle medlyng odor smell lyonesse washed spouse breaking riuer ere come lyon plinius saith knoweth guiltie punisheth hir anone therefore flyeth anone commeth hir make first washed lyttle beast lion lionesse dreadeth wonderfully beast called leonzeufones beast beareth certain venime slaieth lion lionesse therefore sayd beast taken afterward burnt flesh sprong ash layd set méeting wayes shall slay destroy lion eate thereof isid sayth lib 12 cap 1 auicen saith lyon beast great gluttonie coueteth desireth much meate deuourer meate therefore without chewing casteth vp therefore meate eateth eateth afterwarde eateth right much heauie meate fasteth afterward space two day two nightes voydeth dirte two day thrée dirte drye without moysture stinketh right fowle doeth vrine also wombe issueth commeth euill smell cut opened breath stinketh right infectious contagious infecteth thing biting deadly venemous namely woode lyon wexeth wood hound doth arist sayth auicen also cruell wood wroth biteth grieueth selfe indignation wroth gnasheth téeth namely hungreth spieth lyeth awayle take beast passe waye hideth himselfe preuie caues reeseth beast vnware slayeth téeth clawes breaketh member eateth péece meale see come take away pray beclippeth pray grunteth smiteth earth tayle commeth nigh lepeth ouercommeth turneth pray first drinketh licketh bloud beast slaieth renteth haleth deale lim meale deuoureth swaloweth ¶de leopardo ca 67 leopardus beast cruell gendered perde lyonesse isi saith li 12 plin saieth lion gendreth perdus perde lionnesse gendering commeth vnkinde perdes horse asse mare male asse gendered mule isi saith leopardis full réesing beast head strong thirsteth bloud female cruell male arist saith hath diuers colour parde hath pursueth pray starting leaping running taketh praye third leape fourth stinteth indignatiō goeth backward though wer ouer come lyke lyon bodye tayle féete shape head lyke parde lesse body lyon therefore dreadeth lyon maketh caue vnder earth double entering one goeth another goeth caue full wide large either entring narrow straight middle lyon commeth flyeth falleth sodainlye caue lyon pursueth great réese entereth also caue thinketh haue masterie leopard greatnesse body may passe fréely middle den full straight leopard knoweth ye lyon let helde ye straight place goeth den forward commeth againe denne side behinde lion réeseth behinde biting clawes leopard hath ofte ye wise masterie lyon crafte strength lesse beast hath ofte masterie strong beast deceipt guyle denne dare reese openly fielde homer saith libro de pugms astucijs bestiarum lib 8 arist speaketh beast called ferculio auicen calleth beast leopardus beast sayth ari called ferculio eateth somtime venemous thing lecketh man dirte eateth therefore hunter hangeth suche dirte uessell trée leoparde commeth tree leapeth vp take dirte hunter slaye meane time thereabout panther doth perdus also sayd ther also plinius speaketh leopard saith somtime leopard sicke drinketh wilde goates bloud scapeth sicknesse wise ¶de lepore ca 68 hare called lepus leuipes light foote hée runneth swiftly called lago • gréeke swiftnesse running li 12 isidore sayth euery swifte beast fearefull fighteth hath manner kinde armour wepon onely lightnesse member lims feeble sight beast close eye lid sléeping better hearing sight namely reareth vp eares eares full long pliant néedefull defend eyen open defended couering heling kéep frō gnat flyes great small noyfull thing kinde giueth remedy creature auicen saieth therefore kinde giueth hare lightnesse pliantnesse limmes swiftnesse course running kéep houndes beast pursue kind giueth long eares gnat flyes grieue oft busiy féeble eyen saith kinde giueth much haire vnder feete haire féete maye defende flesh thereof hurting running lyghtnesse thereof wise let féete running therfore arist saith li 3 hare feete hairie beneath seldome séene beast hinder leg lōger former néedfull reare body flyeth rūneth hil harder take runneth downward toward valley shortnes fore leg lownesse fore part body hée falleth soone runneth downe hill may continue euenly course running séeth shall fall runneth flyeth downe hill runneth therefore aside aslont hill side reareth former leg may towarde highnesse hill side ofte beguileth hound pursueth scapeth wise li 8 ca 55 plini speaketh hare sayth many kindes hare quantitie great haire rough swifte course running called cuniculi héere name lepus name hare cony cony called parui lepores small hare féeble dig earth clawes make bower den vnder earth dwell therein bring foorth many rabets multiply right much woodes spain many conic somtime wast destroy corne fielde cause hunger countrey lande rabets loued iland balearitis yt rabets taken eaten men countrie though gut vnneth cleansed followeth ye archelaus author saith manye den increasing cony many yeres haue age bodye many hoales cony haue yeresnot therefore said gender without male haue sex male female therefore many men suppose conie gendereth gendered without male sayth cony plenteous bring forth much breede bring forth one rabet moe anone hath another hir wombe profitable beast meate clothing many maner medicine ruenning helpeth agaynst venime stancheth flixe wombe bloud abateth ache smarting eyen plinius sayth dioscorides also beast téeth either iawe ruenning found hare arist saith elder ruenning better plinius saith additiōhare conie maketh grose bloud dryeth stoppeth conie maketh better pure nourishing sooner digested hare well proued ther meat wholsome cleane firmelye temperatelye nourisheth rabets ¶de lince cap 69 linx lincis beast hath name accounted among kinde wolues beast like woolfe backe diuersly spekled parde vrine changeth tourneth precious stone called ligurius precious stone also called linx lincis beast linx hath enuie sorie tourne vse mankinde hideth vrine vnder ground hee pisseth sooner hard turneth stone plin saith li 8 ca 39 isid 12 ¶de limace cap 70 limax worme slyme hath name limax bréedeth slime slime therefore alway foule vncleane isid saith lib 11 verye slowe worme moouing beareth harde shell backe closeth therein horned worme hath two small horn mouth féeleth grieuous thing draweth horn anone shell closeth himselfe shell within house wormes gendered principally corrupt aire raine hée créepeth though slow pace commeth vp top trées biteth gnaweth bud fruite thereof euer créepeth slydeth leueth glemy froth strake vncleannesse additiōin italy vse eate snailes custome vsed england phisitions haue made many beléeue well cleansed salt vineger sallet restoratiue snake good whence one custome eaten ¶de lupo cap 71 woolfe called lupus hath name isid sayth leopos hath vertue féete lyon hath treadeth feete liueth rauenous beast desireth coueteth bloud slayeth may finde woodes rauine husbandman speake say man léeseth voyce woolfe séeth first therefore man sodainly still leaueth speake sayd lupus est fabula woolfe tale certainly know seene first léeseth boldnesse hardinesse fiercenesse yeare wolues déed generation xii day may dure hunger long time deuoureth much long fasting aethiopia wolues haire maanes necke speckeled haue manye diuers colour lacke manner colour telleth huc vsque isid li 13 cap 23 plin saith saith also wolues affrica slender lyttle bred colde country landes lesse body sharpe fierce libro secundo arist saith indie woolfe hath thrée rowes téeth aboue hath féete like lyon face man tayle scorpion voyce wer man voyce dreadfull trumpe beast swifte harte right fierce cruell eateth men also libr 6 aristo saith time generation wolues full cruell fierce worse haue whelpes female hound also lib 7 wolues haue sawie téeth eate flesh grasse sicke eate grasse hearb medicine woolfe féeleth himselfe full séeketh certaine hearbe eateth maye cast vp hath eaten also li 8 flye beare whelpes eate origanum hearb margerū chew go den whet sharpe téeth therwith also saith woolfe full euill beast eateth resteth much hath hunger full hardie loueth well playe childe maye take slayeth afterward eateth ye last homer saith wolfe full wakefull beast flyeth sight fire said woolfe stoned taketh héed throweth first stone stone grieueth pursue hurt grieueth may take throweth stone doeth much harme harme doth wrath leueth last elder wolues worse greue men may hunt beast olde reason vange téeth weked liue long time age woolfe perceiued téeth constrained age ther saith double manner kinde wolues wer round long rough haire thicke bolde hardie hart entrailes wolues right féeble take soone corruption wounded deale bodie suffereth many stroke hath great strengthe necke head also woundes theyr biting euill venimme commeth wound heled biting mad hound aristo saith also lib 13 saith yt woolfes mouth openeth wide hath strēgth mouth beast great glutton deuoureth much also li 7 auicen speaketh woolfe saith woolfe desireth kindlye eate fish eateth fish fisher throw net hée findeth nothing eate fisher leaue goeth net breaketh renteth phisiologus speaketh wolues saith vertue strength breast clawes mouth lest hinder part woolfe may bend neck backward month yere maye alone thundereth hath cruell warinesse hée taketh pray meate nigh ye place nourisheth whelpes hunteth place far thence goeth night folde take pray goeth winde hound smel hapneth wise foote maketh noyse treading vppon thing chasteth foote hard biting eyen shine night lanternes solinus saith beareth taile locke haire exciteth loue doth away téeth dreadeth taken woolfe dreadeth greatly stone man take two stone smite togethers woolfe looseth boldnes hardinesse flyeth away noyse stone commeth hearing woolfe whelpeth blinde whelp loueth nourisheth full tenderly eateth earth sore hungred findeth none praye hideth grasse bush shrub leaues rauish take goates gather leaues crop trées deceiueth shéepe guile wrench might strength hath mastery suffered biteth slayeth flocke part may deuoure burieth hideth vnder earth diggeth taketh vp part agayne hungred infecteth wool shéepe slaieth maketh cloth lowsie made wooll isidore saith also arist saith kinde wolues contrarie aduersarie kinde shéepe haue read booke string made wolues gutproued rare vvonderful secret put among harp string made gut sheepe destroyeth corrupteth eagle fethers put among culuers pilleth gnaweth lefte together long one place saith looke de aquila de mulo cap 72 mule called mulus hath name molendo grinding vnder yoke baker draweth milstones isid saith libro 15 iewes tell ana esau nephew made first ass mare haue first kinde kinde mule bred gendred saith therefore mule followeth kind mare asse fairer swifter slow fouler lesse horse mule barren beast neuerthelesse noble beast trauaile plinius saith lib 8 ca 44 beast mare asse desire neuer gender together except together youth sucke togethers coltes therefore heards put set coltes sucke ass asse colt sucke mare haue beast gendered betwéene beast diuers kinde saith also saith wine drinking forbidden ye mule wilde ass mare swifte mule gendred hard féete able runne haue great riuells body wilde heart neuerthelesse gentle gendered betwéene wild asse mare passe libro septimo aristotle speaketh mule saieth water mule drinketh good meate doth also li 14 mule hath gall openlye séene vpon liuer also lib 21 saith mule gendered betwéene asse mare gendereth kinde either asse mare colde coldnesse sire dam hath masterie mule gendered therefore mule barren nothing gendred séede reason passing colde hath mastrie also sayd hapneth body mule great huge menstruall superfluitie passeth nourishing féeding body bloud néedeth kinde passeth vrine therefore ye male mule smell vrin ye female mule beast haue houes deale superfluitie passeth increasing greatnesse body therefore female mule conceiueth hap full selde male mule hot male kind gendreth somtime country land hap gendereth straunge occasion yt gendred betwéene horse asse worthye one barren gendered kind huc v que arist li 16 isaac dietis saith mule flesh worse nourishing defieng ass flesh dirt stamped burnt stauncheth bloud tempered vineger dioscorides saith dirte helpeth stinging scorpion saith additiō musmoue kinde great shéepe white somtime bred north iles scotland hector boetius affirmeth bignesse bucke horned round bending forme betwéene sheepe goate strong swifte read gesner addition fol 10 de mure cap 73 mouse called mu little beast isido sayeth hath name humus earth breadeth gendered humor earth earth called mu humus also lyuer beast wexeth full moone lyke certaine fish sea increaseth waneth againe waning moone mouse called sorices also fret gnaw thing saw huc vsque isid lib 12 libro septimo arist saith mouse drinketh drinketh dyeth gluttonous beast therefore beguiled little meate smelleth taste thereof vrine stinketh biting venemons vrine contagious also taile venemous accounted also lib 8 cap 38 plinius speaketh mouse saieth mouse wittie gather meate dennes hide themselues dennes winter time palate perfect taste also nose smell haruest male female gather corne charge eyther vppon wombe male draweth female charged taile hir denne dischargeth hir layeth vp stuffe place denne goe againe trauaile gather eares corne male layeth himselfe owne backe female chargeth taketh taile hir mouth draweth home denne beare burthen charge chaunge course ste •• time also saith mouse diuers maner kind mouse liueth house field bank brim water depart yeare atwaine sléeping sléepe halfe yere glires doe certaine maner mouse plin saieth though mouse full grieuous noyfull beast yet many thing good profitable medicine plin saith lib 29 cap 7 ash mouse honye oyle dropped eares doth away ache griefe worme entreth commeth • chiefe remedie gall mouse tempered wt wine dropped warme eares dioscorides sayth mouse durt brused vineger cleanseth euill allopicia kéepeth sa 〈…〉 falling haire also durt stamped wine taken drinke softneth wombe wonderfully 〈…〉 skinne laid héele heleth saueth kybes wound therefrom additiōmany kindes mouse gesnes depressed field mouse farie long snoute sleeper • un coulour runne edge sword sléepe vpon payne de mustela cap 74 wesell called mustela called long mouse isi saith li 12 long called telon gréek beast hath guileful wit nourisheth hir kittons house beareth place place chaungeth place dwelling hir neast found wesell pursueth chaseth serpent hateth eateth mouse wesels double manner kinde one dwelleth woodes gréeks call lo • da goeth house opinion false mean wesells conceine mouth kitneth eare isid saith li 12 wesell enemie sparowes lyeth awaite small birdes swalloweth vp egges wesels kitten fall hap chin pit hurt dead wesell heleth certain hearb reareth death life pli saieth eateth rewe bawmeth hir selfe iuyce thereof réeseth cockatrice assaileth slaieth without dred boldly pli saith li 8 ca 22 said vertue wesells death cockatrice god kinde nothing without help wesell knoweth soone cockatrice goeth den slaieth beast sléepeth much wexeth fat sléepe mouse doe called glires saith also li 29 ca 1 saith ye wesell double kind fame wilde either hath gall yt helpeth much adder preuie chose stinketh right foule stinking thing contrary adder serpent meane flesh helpeth venim wesel burnt ash helthfully done medicine helpeth litargie ye sléeping euill man fall litargy sléeping euill venimme adder ash wesel tempered drop water dissolueth destroyeth ye strength might ye sléepe saith ther said ye pouder helpeth fester kind yt mother gendreth nothing without great cause sayd li 8 arist saith yt wesell fighteth serpent either eate mouse swift beast mouing pliant body full slipper vnstable wise smell hath red white wombe changeth coulour country somtime ye yeare skinne white except tayle biting malitious venemous vrine stinketh vrine mouse additiōthe wesell ictis mustela meruailous stinking beast pursued furunculus little théefe also wesell de migali cap 75 firet called migale little beastvicterram hebrue oach wesell glutton guilefull rauener wt guile rauisheth eate afterward glose saith sup leu 11 dred saineth himselfe mild man commeth nigh biteth anone sheddeth venimme sayd ther arist speketh beast migale faith hateth horse mule grieueth lieth specially await mare foale fighteth serpent armeth rewe saith additiōthe ferret common enemie conic vsed euill disposed rob warren night pursnets hayes de murilego ca 76 cat called murilegus musio also cattus hath name murilegus cat enemie mouse rat commonly called cattus hath name rauening rauisheth mouse rat el hath name cattus cata sée séeth sharply ouercommeth darknesse night shining lyght eyen name cattus commeth gréek vnderstand slye wittie isi saith li 12 beast vncertaine haire colour cat white red black skewed speckled féete face eares like leopard hath great mouth sawie teeth sharp long tongue pliant thin subtill lappeth ther whē drinketh beast haue nether lip shorter ouer vneuennesse lip beast sucke drinking lap lick ari saith plin also ful lecherous beast youth swift pliant merie leapeth réeseth al thing yt led straw plaieth therwith right heuie beast age full sléepy lieth slily waite mouse ware smell sight hunteth réeseth priuy place taketh mouse plaieth therwith eateth play wilde goeth time generation among eats time kind hard fighting female one scratcheth renteth ye grieuously biting clawes make ruthfull noise gastfulcalled catervvauling one prosereth fight another cruell beast wilde dwelleth wood hunteth smal wild beast cony hare falleth owne féete falleth high place vneth hurt throwen downe high place durte doth stink • ful foule therfore hideth vnder earth gathreth thervpon couering féete clawes hath faire skin wer proud therof goeth fast skin burnt bideth home ofte faire skin taken skinner slaine additiōthe propertie cat climbe trées bird also kill mouse néere warren sake house become wild praieng rabits bird de noctiluca cap 77 noctiluca litle beastthe glovvorme wt féete wing therefore somtime accounted amōg volatile shineth darknes candle namely ye hinder part foule dark full light infecteth smiteth hand toucheth though vnséene light yet flieth light hateth goeth night contrary another little one called lucipeta riseth gladly oft light isid saith lib 12 cap de minutis volatilibus c odonta year world 3640 néere therabout alexander ye great entring india great army dronke beholding tentes sodeinelye settle vppon souldiers great vyolence neither driuen backe heat fire ouerthrow sayd straunge fierce beast 36 souldiers slaine 53 sauchenets sword time quite marred company female haue enuy male foaled bite gendering stone female bée ware thereof hide theyr male foales priuy place plini sayth li 8 betwéene wilde ass tame ass li 2 gendered swift ass free beast large tamed lecherous hunteth oft mountaines woodes though hée himselfe beast fighteth gréeueth yet benefice running lyghtnesse ouercommeth desart lyon wolfe beast maye well awaye thirst suffereth long abideth vntill maye drink couenable phisiologus speaketh saith 25 daye march beast roareth twelue time day oft night roaring euennesse day night knowen among affrikes saith alwaye roareth manye trauaile roareth ioy findeth therin gréene grasse hearbes hée knoweth hée hunted men beast flieth hateth greatly company men loueth well desart place wildernesse de onocentauro cap 79 onocentaurus conceiue yane vntil 8 yeare li 7 sheepe conceiue toward northen wind conceiue male conceiue toward ye southern winde conceiue female veines bée vnder shéepes tongue colour lambe yaned look de agni ariete whē old shéep moued generation certeine time ordeined shepheards say good signe young shéep moued tell yt betokeneth pestilence among shéep yéere also libro 8 aristotle sayth shéepe conceiue drinking water therefore heardes giue salte eate make drinke conceiue faster kéepe safe whole without kind sicknesse also haruest giue cucurbita gourde hearbes salt make much milke teates shéepe conceiue tilles salt shéepe fast thrée day cate afterward ware soone fat colde water north good summer warme water ye south good thē haruest meat helpeth end daye night farre wayes long trauaile waxe leane heards know maye dure winter vpon found ise vppon ise founde bée séeble may shake ise shéepes flesh yt nourished watry place euill flesh foure footed beast bée nourished place right moyst watry haue long tailes maye worse away winter haue broade tailes haue litte wooll crispe may worst away winter wooll shéepe wolfe eateth infected cloth made thereof lousie also libro 8 saith shéep lesse wit vnderstanding thē another foure footed beast thunder gréeueth one abide alone euentide may happen shall cast lambe dread also li 8 ca 67 plinius sayth thundering maketh solitary shéep cast lamb remedy helpe thereof gather bring together one flocke looke booke littera treateth de ariete agno additiōof sheepe wooll singular benefit common wealth especially cotsell wooll finenesse bartholmes time staple wooll well husbanded hath bene since increase pasture shéepe hath much decreased tillage corne vntill restored againe wil grow poore common wealth shéepe déerer wooll flesh fell moe shéepe déerer corne graine beside béefe butter egges chéese pasture consumes tillage want tillage bréedes beggar decayes village hamlet vpland townes better want wooll corne shéepe men excesse prodigalitie cannot away measure hath brought england great penurie espyed wanteth wanting espied much lesse regarded de panthera cap 82 panthera isidore sayth libro 12 hath name hée friende beastes saue dragon hée hateth full sore hath ioye lyking beastes owne kinde maketh hée taketh one lykenesse panthera gréeke vnderstande beast painted small rounde speckle skinne without seemeth full eyen diuersitie speckle blacke white red sayeth isidore saith beast whelpeth cause thereof openly knowen whelpes waxe strong dammes wombe strong come world hate damme rent wombe claw ye womb letted whelping comming worlde therefore damme letteth passe whelpeth constrayned compelled sore gréeuance wombe therefore plinius sayth beastes sharpe clawes maye oft whelpe whelpes mooue within hurt damme huc v que isidore
