may liue 15 yeares 20 yeres swine haue many sickness hold head aside sicke wallowe fenne puddle lye right side lefte side waxe fat fortye dayes fat sooner suffer hunger thrée day beginning féeding swine loue knowe others voice therefore crie cry labour helpe might tame swine knowe owne house home learne come therto without guide loadsman hée sayth grunt going lieng sléeping namely right fat swine sléepe faster may othertimes yere commeth fumosity stoppeth braine time summer though great resolution humour greate wasting thereof drieng passing heat summer great generation fumositie yt cause sléepe therefore sleepe summer doe springing time auicen sayth haruest winter humour sad fastened togethers coldnesse aire compasseeth without therfore fumosities resolued time passing cold fastneth humour body hée sayth libro secundo aristotle sayeth swine swine chaunge theyr téeth male hath téeth female also libro 3 aristotle sayth boare leapeth sow eight moneths sowe farroweth one yeare boare gendereth within first yeare full féeble also boare hath vsage gendereth first one sow pigges second sowe fewer number lesse body young sow farroweth first pig shall haue small bodyes sow lib 6 swine haue thrée manner euillsthe dizei • ill one called brancos postume eare iawe oft féet lousie mad flesh place corrupt corruption passeth flesh nigh thereto vntill come lung stuffeth spirit de rana cap 91 frogge called rana hath name noise crieng voice cryeth gréedely maketh much noyse marreys bred isidore sayth libro 12 cap tercio de piscibus frog water frogges bée moore marreys bée called rubete spoken littera byde buphone called calamite dwell among reed called calamus among shrub réedie place little gréene dumbe without voice called agredule small frog dwell lande water haue therefore name agredule ther manner frog maketh hound still dombe commeth mouth many men deny isidore sayeth libro 12 libro quarto aristotle saith frogge hath owne tongue part tongue ioyneth mouth though bound thereto vtter part tongue fish though hinder part inner tongue bee loose slacke toward wosen therefore frog hath owne voice voyce called coax maketh voice onely water properly male time loue crieth female euery beast hath voyce crieth time loue frogge multiplyeth voyce doth neather iawe deale water striketh vpper iawe strength stretching two iawes eyen shineth candle namelye night gendereth night day fish nourisheth féedeth brood except frogge saith li 7 first shapen water frogge séemeth head manner string hanging wer taile afterward spread abroad manner womb taile away groweth féete shapen turned foure footed beast al frog except toad rubeta moue passe leaping going olde rubeta leapeth seld frogge watry moorish crieng slimie great womb speckled vnder venimous abhominable therefore men hated water land liueth de salamandra ca 92 salamandra isidore sayth libr 10 cap 67 like ewt shape neuer séene great raine fayleth faire wether song crieng quencheth fire hée toucheth ise doth water frore mouth commeth white matter matter touch man body haire shall fall toucheth corrupt infected tourneth foule coulour also salamandra manner kind ewt lisard pestilent beast venimous plinius sayeth libro 29 cap 4 salamandra infecteth fruit trées corrupteth water eateth drinketh thereof slayne anone spittle touch foot infecteth corrupteth man body though venimous yet beast eate stéed meate beast onely salamandra liueth fire saith quencheth fire certain kind salamandra hath rough skinne hairy skin sea sele skinne bée sometime girdle made vse king girdle full olde throwne fire harmelesse without went purged renued skinne tongue bond made lampes lanternes neuer corrupt burning fire looke de anguium diuersitate thou shalt finde worme additiōsalamander beast figure like lisard full spottes fire quencheth burned de sanguisuga ca 93 water léeche called sanguisuga water worme hath name loueth sucketh bloud lieth wait vpon drink falleth iaws cleaueth place sucketh drinketh bloud hath dronke ouermuch casteth againe sucketh newe bloud yet againe isidore sayth lib 12 worme part browne colour distinguished deale red strake soft body euenlong plyaunt mouth thrée cornered mouth pipe sucketh bloud sitteth vppon venimous thing therefore shall bée set member medicine first shal wrapped nettle salt thereby compelled cast body haue tasted venimous thing warme water hot time applieth setteth himselfe soone member sucke horse léech de stellione cap 94 lisard called stellio hath ye name owne colour litle beast painted back shining speck star ouid speketh saith yt hath name according colour hée hath diuerse shining speck body shine star isidore sayth lib 12 saith lisard contrarye scorpion scorpion dread léese comfort see lisarde li 8 plin saith lisarde liueth dew though fayre beast faire painted yet right venimous plinius sayth lib 29 cap 2 worst medicine made lisard dead wine couereth face yt drinke therof vile scab therefore eschew put medicine ointment meaneth lisard swift beast feathered neither penned ablenesse swiftnesse foot hée créepeth climbeth vpon top house wall additiō stellio lisard like bodye hath spottes backe lyke starres venimous lacertus lisard greene worme hurtfull de serpente cap 95 serpent hath name serpens serpere créepe créepeth priuy pares gliding goeth steppeth openly créepeth wt priuy putting forth teates isido saith lib 12 héere make processe kind littera cap de angue property declared shewed full noyeth set héere shortly property knowen io de sancto egedio speaketh serpent sayeth hée dreadeth naked man leapeth man clothed spettle venim ye serpent spettle fasting man venim serpent fighteth head therein accounted place heart flesh accounted colde colde kind glydeth ye brest wombe said goeth forth right créepeth renueth himselfe euerye yere liketh moistie place loueth filthy place shadowye looketh aside forthright stingeth also aside téeth dented inwarde crooked bendeth smiteth serpent hideth lepra eaten heale euill yt knowne vseth turne wind te tongue moueth alway strēgth venim serpent fasteth suffreth hunger long time stoppeth eares wil heare inchanters coniurations hunted wine hisseth bileth slaieth biteth enimy birdes slaieth blowing taketh againe thing casted vp taketh againe venim hée casteth de simea cap 96 ape called simea gréeke hath name flat nose call ape simie bée flat nose foule riueled face call simeas giue name lykenesse reason many thing counterfeiteth déeds men false isi saith li 12 sayth ape haue knowledge element sory full moone merie glad new moone ye ape hath two whelp beareth yt loueth best hir armes shoulder beset must néeds flie may beare whelp compelled throw away yt bare armes charged sitteth shoulder slow run flye therfore ye sooner taken ye hunter ape 5 manner kind saith haue tailes ther ape tailea munky babicu marme se • ape called cluna amōg men called cenophe like hound face body like ape also called spinge rough hairie strouting pap teat forgetteth soone wildnesse sati •• pleasing face merrye mouings playengs resteth little bée called calatrices vnlike ye nigh manner point face long beard haue broad taile isidore saith plin saith li 8 cap 54 saith yt kinde ape next man shape diuerse distinguished tailes labour wanderfully busily thing see oft sh • themselues shooes hunter leaue certeine place slily taken sooner would fasten thong shooe wold put ye shooe féete sée ye hunter doe bée oft taken hunter ere may vnloose shooes deliuered also plinius saith ther kind ape loue wel whelp tame ape house sheweth whelpes whelpeth men therein haue liking stroked knoweth comforteth pleaseth maketh good chéere huc v que plinius eod li cap 22 saith indie bée ape white ye body ape hunted taken beares inde aud li 2 auicen saith ape accordeth shape man haire wolfe ape haue euil maners tatches teeth hound teeth haue malitious biting namely haue tailes rough hairie except face haue teeth man haue thing man reddish eyen sharpe pap teat breast handes feete finger toe may goe steppe two feete haue sol theyr féet man hath hath beast except man namelye foure footed beast aristotle saith ye female ape like woman priuye chose male yarde like hound yarde entrailes like man entrailes huc vsque auicenne aristotle saith yt foure footed beast commeth man kinde ape rehearseth ye foresaid likenesse ape beast wonderfully shapen hath likenes mankind learned taught taught leape play diuers manner wise vntamed beast malitious kinde tamed chastised violence wt beating cheines refrained clogge may runne freely owne abate fiercenesse outrage ape safeth manner meat vncleane thing therefore séeketh looketh wormes men head throweth mouth eateth thē lion loueth ape flesh eating therof recouereth said sore sicke isido plinius meaneth scorpion isidore sayth libro •• 〈…〉 lande wo • •• crooked thing tayle hath name scorpio gréeke stingeth ••• tayle sheddeth venimme 〈…〉 wound propertie 〈…〉 euer • • h neuer palme hand sayth maner féele first stinging colde therefore horace sayth maturina parum tunc cautos frigora ledunt morow cold grieueth litle also arow venimed called scorpio commeth bow vnto man hitteth sheddeth venim cause hath name scorpio al said vearse following scorpius est signum vemūsque sagitta flagellum effect vearse saith plin li 11 ca 26 speketh scorpion saith bring forth small wormes shapen egges bréedeth feruent right pestelentiall venim serpent venim scorpion noieth gréeueth thrée dayes full sore afterward flaseth soft death holpen succoured sooner ye scorpion smiteth maiden death stroke smiteth stingeth woman also smiteth men soone grieueth noieth morow tide yt finde theyr wayes cōeout den happeneth yt shed venim smiting scorpion taile alway redy smite sting ceaseth momēt gréeuing noieng haue occassion cause hée stingeth smiteth slon • sheddeth smiting white venim apoderus author describeth many maner gréeuous scorpiōs double colour haue sting among scorpion male bée grieuous namely time loue scorpion smaller longer venim gréeuous little midst daye great feruent heate sun also thirst haue certeine knot riuells taile mo haue venim worse haue sometime knot sixe seuen apolodius meaneth yt affrica scorpion haue feather bée full gréeuous winning inchanters gathereth venime diuers land labour beare winged scorpion italy may liue vnder heuen within country italy scorpion bée sometime séene italy gréeuous scithia smite blacke swine die soone bath thē water afterward man smitten ye scorpion ash scorpion burnt dronke wine remedy also scorpion drowned oile helpeth succoureth beast bée strong scorpion scorpion hurteth beast hath bloud scorpion bréed bring forth leauen young scorpion sayd scorpion eateth sometime one flie leapeth thigh scorpionesse sitteth safe sure stinging taile biting mouth slaieth hée worketh death young kinde ordeineth prouision pestilentiall kinde multiply much huc vsque plinius libro 11 aristotle lib 7 sayth scorpion doe eate venimous thinges haue worse venime dragon doe eate scorpion bée worst stinging scorpion bée manye remedyes sayde libro de venenis perfectly treated additiōin italy manye scorpion much lyke cricket browner indignation de tragelapho cap 101 tragelaphus called hircoceruus also hath name tragelaphus tragos yt goat bucke elephos hart isid saith lib 12 called tragelaphi among ye gréeks kind hart haue rough talpa little beast somewhat like vnto mouse beast isidore speaketh libr 12 saith damned euerlasting blindnesse darknesse without eyen hath snowte swine diggeth therewith earth casteth vp diggeth farther hunter delyuer hir young de tinea cap 105 moth called tinea worme clothes isid saith hath name holdeth cloth hée vntill within eateth gnaweth gendered corruption cloth cloath long presse 13 beast hath stales feather shell hath bladder scarcitie drinke superfluitie drinke passeth fethers thing except ye tortuse loung fleshie bloudy like l •• ng cowe lung wilde tortuse hee body hath bladder raines de vacca cap 109 cowe called vacca hath name boacta isidore saith libro 12 incresing beast aristotle saieth libro 6 cowe moued deede kind one yeare perchaunce eight month cowe sayth ye end men meane cow goeth ten moneths calueth time calfe liueth clées full complete commonly calueth one calfe perchaunce twaine female lyueth commonly xv yeares male also bee gelded strong may liue xx yeare cowe hath good milke caluing milk haue milke litle worth nothing value cowes milke first crudded made tough falleth medled water yeareling cow commeth seldome bull kine toe often calue haue many calues token men meane winter shall much raine kine lyue companye ofte lost goe companye wilde beast eate also among beast male haue stronger greater voyce except kine haue greater voyce bull also saith ye cow hath stronger horne knottie male great heated maye bowed toward side haue sore féete medicine therefore annoynt betweene horne oyle pitch medicine also saith kine loue drink cléere water drinke vneth neuer troubly water thicke haue podagre die euill token thereof beare downe eares eate saith fat cowe shunneth yoake vsed beate last fat lyeth hir owne dirte wexeth fat agresti cap 110 sometime cowe wilde cowe auicen speaketh arist also say lande parthia cow hath haire hir necke horse quantitie hart therefore many men call cow equiceruus cow without horn dwelleth mountaines woodes hath faire eyen sharpe sight somtime cow hath horne litle horne hart calfe bend backward horn goat bucke hir heart bone found hart hart bone bloud warmeth tickeling moueth sinewes substaunce heart cause mouing beast ioye lyking suche tickeling areareth sodainly head leapeth swiftly startleth also li 8 arist saith beast yt maye haue helpe horne haue maner helpe succour kind kind giueth switnesse hart wilde kine haue crooked horne may greatnesse defend bodye therefore kinde giueth another help wild cow helpeth hir greatly casting dirte shée noyeth hound come nigh hir also hound finde dirte occupie smell thereof vntill beast may fight fled scaped perill heereof looke littera b de boue bubalo yt wild beast de vitulo cap 111 calfe called vitulus hath name virore aetatis springing age isi saith lib 12 calued anone riseth vertue seeketh cowes vdder sucketh anone licked cowes tongue cleansed manner filth commeth hir wombe calfe calued hath certaine blacke specke forhead witch meane specke whelke exciteth loue cowe biteth away specke calues forhead receiueth hir teates ere foresayd venime taken done away ari saieth mare hir colte auicen also looke litera e de equa calfe loueth dam knoweth hir lowing followeth hir busheth forhead ye vdder sucketh getteth milke dam full hath wel sucked merie glad leapeth startleth leaping goeth dam foores also lib 8 arist saith calues gelded one yeare gelded shall little body calfe gelded manner throwen downe ground skinne cut slit gendring stone cut string thereof areared vpwarde sinewes also caruing bound vntill bloud passe somtime gendereth postume place burne one gendring stone cut put pouder thereof vppon postume place saued also sea beast lyke calfe therefore called sea calfea seale beast calueth land gendreth hound calueth neuer twaine féedeth whelpes teates bringeth sea vntill eleuenth day teacheth swim euill slaye except hit head lowe calfethey snarle dogge lovve therefore called calues becke make signes hard boūd hir eyen dimmed therfore namely labour get honnie combes mouth wounded stinging bées bléed reléeue heauinesse sore ache eyen head full féeble strong lyon therefore somtime falleth downe headlong vpon rockes falleth vppon grauell dieth soone men saye beares braine venemous therfore slayne head burnt open place men shuld taste braine fall madnes beares fight buls take cruelly mouth eateth fruite trées climeth vpon breaketh bée hiues eateth honie bées grieueth eyen stingeth tongue driueth chaseth awaye sometime eateth crab ante medicine eateth flesh great strength fighteth harte wilde swine hound buls throweth downe ye ground goeth vpright bull ofte holdeth horne fore féete ouercommeth vnpacient beast wrathfull aduenged yt toucheth another touch anone leaueth first réeseth seconde réeseth third taken made blinde bright basin bound chaynes compelled playe tamed beting vnstedfast beast vnstable uneasie goeth therfore daye stake strōgly tied lycketh sucketh féete hath liking iuyce thereof wonderfullye climbe vppon trées vnto highest top ofte bées gather honie hollowe trées beare findeth honie smell goeth vp place honnye maketh waye trée clawes draweth honie eateth commeth ofte custome vnto place hungred hunter taketh héed thereof pitcheth full sharpe hooke stake foote trée hangeth craftely right heauie hammer wedge ye open way ye hony beare commeth hungred female beare called vrsa beast cruell hir whelpes stolne right busie saue hir whelpes therefore licketh busilye giueth sucke nourisheth putteth hir selfe ofte foorth hir might would take away hir therefore brock helpeth foxe betwéene foxe brocke kindelye wrathand often foxe ouercommeth brock guile might strength right gluttonous beast deuoureth much gendreth blinde whelpes doth lyon woolfe agaynst biting serpent smiting scorpion among wormes footlesse adder serpent haue sixe féete bée full euill malitious enimies mankinde serpentes venimous wormes wormes round body hath sinewes bone great small neyther gristle neither bloud dieth annointed oyle quicken againe vineger aristotle sayeth wormes gender gendered gendered gender salamandra wormes sexe male female diuerse manner many wormes diuerse lesse de vermiculo cap 116 vermiculus right little worme nowne vermiculus nowne diminutiue commeth nowne vermis oft small wormes found trées fruite sayde secundo regum 24 dauid lykened tender trée worme called teredo terebucca softe kinde yet pearceth gnaweth verye hard trées nothing harder hée toucheth nothing softer groped glose sayth specially landwormes doe bréede earth leaues fruit trées come earth winter passed away springing time worme doth hate also doth voide salt thing toucheth thing annointed bitter thing strong smelling doe eat linnen clothes moath doth eate gnaw occasion destroyeng wasting wollen clothes destroye cloth namely made wooll shéepe bitten wolues wooll shéep bitten woulfe gendereth louse moaths aristotle sayth libro 8 additiōlice commeth also cloth trained wooll fatte greace horse swine therefore ye northen clothes worne sweting bodye doe bréede louse 12 houres plin li 10 saith yt little worme foule soft round vtter partes small middle great biteth trée priuely wasteth passeth drawing himselfe mouth féet vile pliant soft al worm kind touch tast pli saith li 11 ca 71 therfore hide thēselues perceiue noise haue knowledge betwéene sauours wormes forsake bitter salt loueth sucketh thing swéet taketh néedeth téeth clawes • out pearceth sting sucketh licketh swalloweth casteth vp eateth lesse diuersity seruice féet take diuide rent beare downwarde wey ceaseth digge earth plinius saith lib 10 cap 71 de vipera cap 117 vipera manner kinde serpent full venemous serpent isid speaketh lib 12 saith vipera hath name bringeth forth broode strength hir wombe draweth time whelping whelpes abideth couenable time kinde passing gnaweth fretteth side dam come world strength death bréeder said male doeth mouth mouth female spetreth semen wexeth woode lyking increase biteth head ye male male female slaine male dieth gendring female dyeth whelping serpent vipera made pastees called trocisci tiriaci made triacle remedie venim li 8 ca 40 plin speaketh adder vipera saith hideth chin deus earth adder serpent hide themselues hollow stone trées adder vipera sustaineth may beare hunger long time strong winter commeth den vnder earth casteth first away venime doth sléepe vntill springing time come againe pore earth open heate sunne serpent vipera awaketh commeth den sight apppaired long abiding vnder earth séeketh roote fenell looke héereafter de coloribus aristotle li meth saith colour vttermost part cléere thing bodye determined vtter part bodely thing sight sheweth diuersitie colour taketh kinde medling mastrie element bodye compouned cléere thing bright medled actuall ioyning light shineth vpon vtter part cléere bodye bright colour sheweth presenteth vtter part sight therfore secundo de anima arist saith coulour chaungeth sight giueth therto likenesse working lyght light perfection cléere thing bright bringeth kinde coulour medled body kindly mastrie element chaunging déede perfection sight though colour essentially kindly medled body yet hath colour might shew himselfe light shineth actually therevpon alway shew himselfe colour néedeth light light shew selfe néedeth colour colour néedeth light shineth déede print thereby qualytie coulour line sight therefore men meane reason thinges séene rooted shapen lyght expresseth beautie lyght light lacketh faulteth qualytie coulour séene déede colour darknesse commentour saith de anima treateth sheweth changing likenesse colour sight light maketh coulour coulour indéede masterie element body medledas lyght maketh colour color beeing nothing vvithout light light shineth without open colour space place colour disposeth place giueth shape maye receiue likenesse colour light disposeth likenesse space diuersitie colour commeth eye iudgement colour therefore déede colour abide darknessethey abide bee discerned vvhat commentour sayeth openly therefore author perspectiue saith li 1 ca vltimo light néedeth sight coulours one two cause without lyght shape likenesse coulour spreadeth aire though darknesse spredde aire yet worketh sight light néedeth colour onely shewing thereof though coulour séene perceiued darkness yet neuerthelesse coulour idle darknes continually matter perfect within though colour séene perceiued darknesse ye shall vnderstande default colour default thing receiue take disposition lacketh néedeth receiuing taking author tell place coulour déede without light shal vnderstood knowen deede sight light arayeth colour maketh first seene knowen theyr kinde maketh first thou vnderstand light shineth without vpon thing ye vertue lyght heauen commeth vnseene inner part thing gendreth color help foure quality element gendred kind commeth light maketh cleere noble sheweth sight eye de materia coloris cap 2 cléere thing well termined matter colour onelye namely thing moyst drye earthie cléere insomuch drye fierie drought commeth downe sphere place fire found héere beneath among v onely forme fire matter fast hard yet take anone fastnesse hardnesse cause worketh see many thing yt cold bréedeth soone white coulour snowe well seene ensample colde worketh dry matter worketh meanly together meane medled bodye darke passeth woorke deede comming outwarde light also coulour séene within declareth might feeblenesse fire hidde might meddeled bodye thereby vertue working thereof knowne proporcionally diuersity coulour exciteth kindlye sight looker looke wonder thereon plinius sayth libro octauo auicen also sayeth euery beast neuer fierce wondereth duersitie fairenesse coulour panther also euery man face made beautiful vnbeautifull coulour ordinate colour fayre complection fairenesse miswexeth duely making composition member limmes auicen sayth austen saith fairenesse séemly shape body wt pleasing colour againward vile coulour vnséemely right foule bodye also colour token accident passion ye soule sodeine palenesse discoulour token dread ye heat drawen inward part bodye face scarcitie bloud face discouloured also sodeine rednesse face token shame wrath heate commeth outwarde bloude maketh skinne redde without busieth put shame wronge also coulour termineth arayeth bodye excepte couloure bée bodye substance thereof knowne sight also couloure maketh fayre matter without hideth defaultes bée within compounded coulour meane betwéene white blacke layed order kinde auicen sayeth without vppon bodye hideth couereth infirmitie matter accidentally eyther kinde auicen sayth also coulour accordeth agréeth lyght daughter mother followeth lyghte deede greate growe earth first fruite gréene groweth fareth beryes grape waxe red pale blacke last changing coulour commeth diuersitie kinde heate heat sunne doth seeth substaunce fruite diuerse manner wise first working heat féeble soft vnsufficient dissolue depart ye earthie matter make spread therefore fruite without gréene colour vndigest earthy kinde heat waxeth stronger heat sun worketh therefore strongly heat strength thereof leaueth red coulour fruite without last fruite compleat ripe sowre humour earthy defied burning commeth blacke colour fruit without heat hath mastry dissolueth doth séeth defieth earthynesse taketh much néedeth turneth substance fruit wasteth deale putteth bringeth vtter part fruite fumositie cast earthy infecteth maketh fruit blacke yeolow without said super li vegitabilium commento coulour betokeneth themselues working kind cold oft gendered thing bée full hot commeth cause heat hath mastry within doth put earthy watry fumosities alphredus sayth super aristot de vegitabilis plantis also beast chaunging coulour skinne eyen eare nailes coulour ye skin gendred two manner sayde ioannico gendred commeth sometime humour inwarde sometime passion soule also chaunging coulour skin commeth inner thing sometime hot humour sometime cold happeneth hot humour compowned simple cooleth bée colde also colde humour cooled heateth according therevnto colour skinne wont varie colde humoures waxe hotte white colour turneth citrine red hot humour doth coole red coulour doth chaunge white pale vnderstoode also chaunging skin commeth passion soule red waxeth pale anguish dreade dreade heart closeth heate vtter partes draweth inward therefore vtter partes waxe pale also pale waxeth red wrath wrath heart openeth desireth wreake heat passeth sodeinly inner part vtter part bloud heateth betwéene skin flesh red colour sodeinly gendered also men nation maures blacke coulour commeth inner part whitish colour almains dutchman ye countrye mauritania hottest country aethiopia ye country greate heate bloud burnt betwéene skinne flesh maketh member black hée first dwelled aethiopia made black afterward continuall heat sunne blacknes sprang ofspring blacke father blacke mother commeth blacke child place onely father mother continually burnt heate sunne therefore temperate country land yt somwhat cold swart coloured men getteth child temperate coulour macrobius aristotle auicen meane contrarywise almaynes scot dwell colde country colde stoppeth hoales poores without heate drawne inward therefore skin white without cōmentour telleth al super ioh aristot toucheth also coulour skinne chaungeth namely man skin many occasion somtime euill complection fareth melancholike menspecial token knovv complections great passing heat fareth cholarike men citrine coulour heat sun drinesse aire fareth wayfaring men shipmē spreading corrupt humour betwéen ye skin flesh fareth morphea lepr • stopping liuer distemperate qualitie gall fareth ianders chaunged kind colour foule coulour vnséemly constantine saith continuaunce solution skin fareth mesells pock wound botch burning also haire diuers colour quality fumositie resolued bodye colour haire diuers fleame commeth white haire bloud red kind melancholy yeolowe cholera adusta black defalt kind heat commeth hoare haire fareth old men horenesse beginneth root haire commeth much fleme beginneth vtter end token commeth default kind heat looke tractatu de capillis coulour eies ca 10 heereafter take héed colour eyen iohannicius sayth coulours eien foure black whitish changeable yeolow diuersitie cōmeth cléernesse spirit sight dimnes therof scarsite ye christalline humour deepnesse therof superfluity whitish humour disturbance therof scarsity superfluitye humour curtell yt called vua humour christaline scarce quātitie hid within whitish humour called albugines falleth disturbed much blacke humour skinne curtell called vua come together blacke colour gendered eie whitenes cōmeth contrary cause yeolow colour diuers colour commeth thinges maketh white blacke yeolowe somewhat blacke white diuerse somewhat white black héereof séeke tractatu oculorum nailes coulour knowen colour thereof shall bée white cléere mirror colour changeth wan pale colour token diuers passion said tractatu de vnguibus coulours perticular chap 14 followeth speake perticular colour first white chiefe fundament ground meane colour whitenes colour gendered much cléere light pure matter cléere algasel saith pure cléere matter cléere ye light white colour lesse medled black ye materiall cause white colour cléere pure without medling earthy draft dry moist cause working making white coulour cold heat drinesse hath mastry working therin thē white colour gendered thinning subtilling partes matter cléering vertue might heat fareth lime burnt bone matter moyst substance colde hath mastrye working therein white colour gendered fareth snow dew therfore white gendred aire deale watry aristotle sayth lib 19 de animalibus working colde colde maketh moyst matter white drye matter blacke also white matter gendered chinning spreading ayre fareth skumme therfore hot water gendereth white haire hot braine cause baldnesse white commeth vapourable aire watry member white commeth hot ayre vapourable therfore beast white vnder wombe ari saith li 19 de animalibus white hath vertue shed sight shed ye visible spirit white maketh eie watry drop ground coulours meane colour bée grounded coulour better white white ground faster coulour cleaueth abideth laied therevppon whether bée white black whitenesse belongeth apperteineth candor albor palior liuor flauor one meaning flauum liuidum one aristotle sayth cap de sapore sayth ye liuidum flauum hée followeth kinde white phisitions doe assigne many maner colour white watrie colour milkie colour karapos whitish palish diuers matter diuerse rotted thick thinne sayd libro de isaac theophile constantine egid de vrinis candor passing whitenesse hath selfe much light forme much purenesse cléerenesse matter blasing brightnesse ye dresseth matter without cléere pure printeth likenesse sight without gréening eye comforteth sight behold theron manner liking whitenes called candor yt first séene whitnesse lyght without corruption sight called candor vttermost whitenesse séene eie voideth ye dome sight nothing may séene vnder vttermost coulour vttermost colour vnseene themselues cleerenesse thereof said li de sensu sensato cap octauo first séene whitenesse tearmed candor de colore glauco siue flauo cap 12 s̄alowe gendred whitenessalovve drawing deale toward red gendered aui meneth matter yt somdeale temperate comparison gréene colour saith gréene colour trées chaungeth yeolow haruest time leaues much matter moisted matter yeolow thicke part wasted working heat destroyed though cold hath mastry cold yt hath mastry meane matter gendreth néedely meane colour colde may better chaunge moysture drinesse gendereth meane coulour hath much white yeolow coulour commentour saith super arist de plantis fine therefore sayth yt tree gréene summer pale winter boxe boxe hath gleaming humour much thin moisture root leaues therof fall heat commeth humour drawen outward heat worketh maketh gréene colour colde commeth humour smitten inwarde leaueth much drinesse earth colour yeolow comparison gréen colour yt moist matter saith yeolow hath temperate matter de pallido colore cap 13 palepale coulour gendered cause cold lesse strong whitenesse draweth towarde blacknesse gendred thick matter polence mene colour beginneth white passeth kind toward blacke also pale coulour happely gendred commeth dread right great businesse great trauaile cause bloud drawen inwarde bodye pale discouloured without scarsitie lacking bloud fareth doe sléepe much slumberous men men trauell loue burne great loue heart therevpon spirit passe thereof féede restore kind bringeth heate vtter partes withdrawing hot bloud skin discoloured without saith palleat omnis amans hic est color aptus amanti vearse meaneth euery louer pale pale coulour couenable louer cause pained hunger great businesse trauaile bée pale spending wasting hotte bloud additiōand also gilding plate force quick siluer vapour whereof cooleth bloud dryeth body de rubeo colore cap 14 red coulour euen middle coulour betweene white blacke euen lyke farre part cleere body incorporation cleere firye light pure generation colour colour come togethers cléernesse matter firy light according meanes betweene white black firy light duo keth cleane part yt medled maketh thin subtill coulour accordeth blasing white black therfore déep red sheddeth sight cleere light doth gathereth sight blacke doth therefore draper yt sell cloth hang red cloth lightno policy plaine subtilty ye rednesse shuld dazell spirit sight men see clothes coulours shuld know worse colour red colour general token mastry heat medled body though hee bee somtime found without bodye kindly cold fareth red rose kindly colde drie rose full subtill substance kind colour hath composition slaieth mastry cold commeth outward findeth vtter partes subtill moist receiue chaunging chaungeth without red colour namelye lykened working fire de colore croceo cap 15 betwéene saffron colour punice citrine little diuersitie abating whitenesse deale medling increasing blacknesse strength heat feeblenes cold coulour subtill matter cléere radicate shineth appeareth grose earthy matter lesse bright colour betokeneth might temperate heat passing insomuch yt belongeth betokening colour diuers disposition substance betokeneth diuerse disposition sicknesse health diuers complections state body said li isa de vrinis citrine coulour thin substance vrine child cholarike complection betokeneth yt whole good point stematike body melancholike may token diuers sickness euills egidius saith vearses tractatu de vrinis cap 13 wise est multis tenuis citrina referta figuris flumaticum iuuenem vel quem niger afficit humor condempnat tricham duplici c coulour betokeneth diuerse thing contrary diuersitie substance de colore croceo ca 16 saffron colour dieth coloureth humour licours citrine betokeneth passing heate distemperaunce bloud licour medling cholera fareth haue iaunders vrine hath yeolowe spume haue yeolow eyen skinne foule citrine hottest bird complection cholarike bird pray haue vtter part yeolow colour foot bill commeth right much cholarike hot fumositie kinde calleth vtter part haue therefore colour looke de morbis cap de ictaricia treated largely de colore minio ca 17 yeolow colour called minios called also coecinus vermioulus draweth much toward red belongeth therto shinesh blasing fire hath himselfe much brightnesse fire much cléernesse matter therfore coulour right bright blasing matter coulour earthy digged cliffes ye red sea yt dieth couloureth maketh red sea floweth sea yt ouer aegipt taketh rednes therof called red sea veines ye earth red precious stone found earth first dried pured best ground smal betwéen stone tempered white egge painter writer get win much good therewith limne adorne araye make beginning ending sentence vearses capitall letter somtime sharped wt certaine herab yt called coccus ye coulour bright blaseth fire hath name iuyce called coccus diers cloath vse colour much writer docrista gal linacea yeolovve rattel also olde time men vsed sharp colour ye bloud certein worme purple sharped bloud shel fish sharping bloud worme ye coulour called vermiculus olde time isid sayth tractatu de coloribus coulour cleueth fast abideth layde matter man purpose shaue wash parchment vnneth shall shaue wash fast thereof abideth shauing washing de colore puniceo cap 18 citrine colour next redde one tree purple next therto side citrine hath redde white black néerer white blacke purple againe warde next red néerer blacke white aristotle saith secundo de sompuo et vigiliars sayth citrine passeth purpole blacke purple néerer red blacke sea citrine shell fish founde small little cut end commeth thereof redde droppes kept dropper purple dyed redde coulours mastred bloud gathered great quantitie kept vessells dyer done coulours therewith purple 〈…〉 e dyed whi • h • wath wouen therby shewed wealth ioy king gregory saith super cant cap 7 de colore viridi cap 19 gréene coulour gendered bred working heate meane matter moisture hath somwhat mastrie fareth leaues hearbes fruit also grasse therefore coulour gendered hath much blacke fully blacke medling light white yeolow much blacke moyst bodye without gréene colour gendered heate worketh matter may burne moysture neyther séeth full turne fully blacke gréene coulours grasse hearbes fruit signe token rawe humour vndigested knowen gréene colour hearbs trées turneth yeolow haruest time leaues hearbs much moyst matter thicke wasted working heate without heat matter borne vp though cold hath mastry therefore trées bée gréene springing time summer pale haruest winter heate springing time commeth beareth humour outward humour taketh heat made gréene colde commeth smiteth humour inwarde much drynesse colour yeolow commentor sayth super li de plantis fine also gréene meane coulour gendered betweene red blacke knowen passing red cholera vnkinde melancholy yt black meane vnkinde cholera yt rusty gréenish found gréene gréene colour liking ye sight comming togethers firy part earth brightnes fire yt gréene temperate pleaseth ye sight dimnes earth blacknesse nigh black gathereth meanly sight comforteth ye visible spirit therefore colour liking ye sight gréene colour knowne smaragdus stone comforteth eyen ye graue mettall precious stone isidore sayth lapidibus preciosis leaues trées grasse hearbs grow spring grounde bée gréene mastry earthy part grounded matter firy vertue cause yt worketh dissolueth earthy matter maketh subtill thin draweth outwarde fumositie thereof dyeth hearbs colour without blacke red gréene blacke tempereth shedding blasenesse red cléerenesse incorporated ye black maketh meane temperate gréene gendered mastry earthye part firy though fruit hearbes grasse gréene yet gréene blossomes flowres seld neuer found subtiltie ye matter flowres mastrye partes bée watry airie colour shall white watrye firie partes hath mastry ye colour red watry part earthy haue mastry coulour bliew bliewish firie partes airie haue euen much mastrye might colour gréene black ye matter flowres thin subtill taketh meddeling therefore flowrs gréen generally black gréene coulour meane betwéene red blacke comforteth cien looke thereon restoreth comforteth sight therefore harte wilde beastes loue gréene place onelye meate liking sight therefore hunter cloth themselues gréene beast loneth kindlye gréene coulours dreadeth lesse perills hunter looke vpon gréene gregory saith de colore liuido cap20 wanne colour gendered watrie earthy part haue mastry coulour gendered thinges haue colde humour thicke fareth lead certaine stone lead white kind though wan without lead white coulour made called cerusa commentor saith 4 meth wan coulour token mastry cold therefore wan colour vrine token quenching kind heat death beast egidius saith sayth wan vrine betokeneth dead member humour many euills followeth euill paruusenut • itheus medn • falling euill also ashites sinochus breaking veines pose euill ye rib lung tisicke quencheth heate wan coulours de colore liuido malo cap 21 wan coulour euill men beastsmixt betokeneth mastrie cold quencheth kindly heat beginneth slay kindly beat el betokeneth superfluitye melancholye bloud defileth skin without el betokeneth anguish passion heart draweth inwarde heate bloud fareth person bée enuious wrathfull else betokeneth sore falling smiting corrupteth increaseth bloud betwéene skinne fleshthat blacke blievv appeareth thē yt bobbed beaten humour betwéene skin flesh corrupt malice corrupteth infecteth skin expositor saith super 1 ca li de isa vulnus liuore c betokeneth failing spirit kind heat scarsitie therof fareth person haue dropsie etike doe consume wast egidius sayth betokeneth also gowtes ioyntes gowte full sore tendernesse sinewes spirit humore doe gather place lesse hot place worse coloured expedient néedfull worke rehearse cause wan colour make mētion thing fore father haue treated full largely seld remember wan visible smiteth againe gréeueth therfore sight maketh dim blacke blacke fareth yt long prison sée litle naught come prison black sometime grounded moist substance hot heat yt hath mastry bloweth moist vvith siricum pigmentum thereof made colour called pheniceus therewith chiefe principall letter bookes written founde cliffes red sea ye countrie called phenicus colour accounted among fained colour working heate thing small odour accounted 〈…〉 author many thing soide substaunce fareth vineger cam • hore rosa purenesse substance 〈…〉 thereby thing toasted may perfectly knowe line smelling one braueth commeth alone thereby commeth little spirite may perfectly know kinde thing also thing yt smelled commeth certaine subtill fumositie medled aire drawen therewith lim smelling fumositie spirite knoweth well kinde thing thing tasted within layd lim tasting therefore thing verelyer knowen sauour odour consider heereby odour propertie qualitie thing qualitie perceiued known smelling isaac saith thing smelled working heale commeth certaine fumositie medled aire certaine spiritual medling chaungeth aire printeth likenesse therein betweene nosethrills small peeces flesh hanging head breast spirite felyng taketh print likenesse fumositie commeth braine presenteth print likenesse soule also odour maketh body knowen aire meddeled printeth lykened spirit feeling sheddeth selfe abroade aire pearceth inward commeth braine blast drowing aire wasteth humor heat thereof stancheth noyfull running releeueth spirites purenes thereof comforteth vertue fablenes heart chaungeth ayre owne lykenesse putteth stench roised thing maketh vnknowen comforteth wit smellyng well beast men fish loueth good odour hate thing stinke doe bee aristotle saith ant flye voyd odour brimstone venemous wormes beast haseth good odour thing smell well odour rewe noyous serpent botraces suffereth odour uines 〈…〉 nemous frogges de fetore cap 4 • stinking vapour resolued commeth corrupt thing infecteth aire displeaseth corrupteth spirites smelling good odour feedeth comforteth spirite smellyng clenche displeaseth spirite isaac saith fumositie commeth thing man complection according spirit feeling body euill odour corrupted humour kinde qualitie thereof passed therefore odour contrary complection man body horrible odour •• tnesseth corruption substance commeth either vnkinde heate corrupt moysture vnkinde heate maketh humour boyle cause rotting stench nourishing breedeth stomacke corruption full euill rottennesse commeth euill fumositie grieueth head onely corrupt moysture cause gendered stench heauie odor heauie odour hot thing vnwholesome foode grieueth lests stinking thing rotted galen saith seene fresh fish smelleth heauely white kinde heate therin stinketh kind heate away fish sodden wasting superfluite corrupt moysture heauye odour taken awaye heat sorthing flesh commended onely odour sauour stench witnesseth corruption sheweth default kinde heate infecteth aire corrupteth spirite féeling exciteth spewing wambling breedeth head ache distempereth complection horrible displeasing wit feelyng therefore fish flyeth voydeth olde stinking wit well commeth fresh new aristotle sayeth also stinke grieuous bee sayth fox durt stinketh foule commeth brockes den defileth dirte driueth broke denne wise plinius sayth ouercommeth stench may ouercome might strength also stenche
